643366707.name: Great history experience
643366707.author: a TripAdvisor user
643366707.reviewBody: Super tour of this newly discovered mine.\nGreat storytellers and tour guides to take you through each floor until you reach the bottom. I found it interesting and informative ..!

612924043.name: A Glimpse Into the Past (and cool off)
612924043.author: a TripAdvisor user
612924043.reviewBody: My girlfriend grew up in Taxco and used to work in the silver industry, so she had been to the mine before, but still enjoyed the tour and found it very interesting, as did I. Our tour guide was top notch and provided us with a lot of insight and historical facts that made the tour very interesting. I highly recommend it because knowing the history of Taxco makes the town seem even more magical. Plus, it\'s a great way to get out of the sun and cool off on a hot summer day!

603684350.name: Interesting
603684350.author: a TripAdvisor user
603684350.reviewBody: Went to Taxco from Mexico City with Mexcity Tours. Included in our Taxco tour was a natural mine where we got a tour inside. There is an interesting story on how they discovered a mine in this location. There use to be a dancing club above ground. The drunk patrons use to bang their head on the low ceiling when passing through a hall. The owners of the establishment decided they were going to dig up the floor to make more room so the patrons could walk through more easily and that is when they discovered a mine below.  They give you a hair net and a hard hat to wear before you go in the elevator shaft to go down in the mine. If you want to take photos there is a group charge. There was another larger Spanish tour group that took the same tour. The tour guide from the mine only spoke Spanish, After the tour, upstairs we all had a Minero cocktail included. It was quite nice made with Mescal, pineapple juice,mineral water and the rim of glass is rubbed with pepper.\n

602501057.name: A drink at the historic hotel above the mine is the cherry on top
602501057.author: a TripAdvisor user
602501057.reviewBody:
I'm claustrophobic and averse to super tourist-y tourist attractions, but I decided to keep my husband company - he did after all indulge my desire to drink pulque in Tepotzlán.

While our guide did not speak English, one of the other two participants on our tour did and she translated for us, which helped us to get much more out of it. Ergo - if you don't speak Spanish, try to arrange to go with someone who can translate, or an English speaking guide. (I did appreciate the guide's attempt to speak very slowly and clearly in hopes we'd catch some.)

i'm glad our group ponied up the communal fee for taking photos - the guide had several spots where he organized us into poses with miners' helmets, lit by flashlight. Hokey, but among a very select few photos of us together in our 23 year marriage!

Your admission includes a drink in the historic hotel's bar. Get that cocktail with mezcal, seltzer and pineapple or lime. It was lovely. Sip it by the pool while admiring the view and a giant mosaic.

600589332.name: nice surprise interesting visit, top attraction in Taxco
600589332.author: a TripAdvisor user
600589332.reviewBody: I went to Taxco for half a day and was told to visit this mine in order to get a grasp of the history of the city\'s silver production. This is an abandoned mine 500 years ago and lies just under the basements of a colonial hotel. Kinda small compared to other mines I have visited but it was very interesting, Mario the guide was very knowledgeable and made a very good visit throughout. At the end they offer you a cocktail by the pool of the hotel with very nice views of the town. Definitely recommended

567471139.name: If you have never been to a mine,maybe it OK.
567471139.author: a TripAdvisor user
567471139.reviewBody: Definitely not worthy the 150 peso it charges(Teotihuacan and National Museum of Anthropology only charge 70),it\'s a very short tour,should only take less than half an hour ,but if you got nothing to do maybe you can go.\nLess than 100 steps/stairs,not as intensive as others described.Staff there are friendly,but not much English introduction.

550315728.name: Lots of stairs
550315728.author: a TripAdvisor user
550315728.reviewBody:
Very nice tour. However as an American who is fluent in Spanish it was difficult keeping track of the tour. Tour guide was great but spoke fast and lightly, we were three families each with kids. 

Be mindful of the stairs, it’s a bit of a workout, definitely need good walking shoes. Would not recommend eating heavy meal before the tour. There is no set time, tours are given as guests arrive. We waited no longer than 5 minutes  

Good idea to bring your own flashlight but not necessary. It’s a little dark in the tunnel. 

We opted for the $150 pesos photos of the tour, your given a CD to take home with the pictures. 
 
Highly recommend may not be suitable for kids under 4 years old.

545649206.name: Adventure for the faint hearted
545649206.author: a TripAdvisor user
545649206.reviewBody: Mina De Taxco was really great for those interested in minerals, mining and simply just exploration.  My fianc\u00e9 and I travel all over, and rather adventurous.  We\u2019ll pretty do anything, as long as we\u2019re able to get back to our kids, without major injury.  This really was a great tour, and the pictures can tell a great story, if you\u2019re into that.  However, from an adventure point of view, it\u2019s like the mine at the Museum of Science and Industry, in Chicago.  Great time, great guide, but nowhere near as adventurous as we had thought.

512815532.name: Incredible!
512815532.author: a TripAdvisor user
512815532.reviewBody: Hands down the best mining activity to visit! They offer great service, the guides are knowledgable and you can see they are proud of their mine. The experience of going down and keeping in mind this was a prehispanic mine from before the spanish conquered is unbelievable. This is a must see attraction!

495704902.name: An experience
495704902.author: a TripAdvisor user
495704902.reviewBody: Located under the Posada la Mission Hotel. An experience!! Not for people who can\'t do a lot of stairs. We had a problem. Still nice. Our guide was good--spoke pretty good English. It was interesting.

457483690.name: A new attraction at Taxco
457483690.author: a TripAdvisor user
457483690.reviewBody:
This is a prehispánico mine below a hotel. It was found just 3 years ago. There is a tour inside the mine 150 pesos per person but if you get a coupon from any taxi cab you can get 10% discount. This price includes a tourist guide plus a soda or beer at the end of the visit. They have a small show to present how the Indians extracted the metals. 

For the teenagers there is a rappel wall 300 m depth. This is another option 300 pesos per person. It looks interesting but It looks more for professionals. 

The classic tour you go 50 mts below but with rappel you can go 300 mts below they said you can watch a small underground river at 300 m depth. 

Any way I liked the visit.

455282337.name: Great experience!
455282337.author: a TripAdvisor user
455282337.reviewBody: Once you visit Taxco you got to visit the Mines. It\'s a great experience. I wish we could\'ve gone even deeper but ok. The guide was very nice and the tour itself was informative! I think the entrance fee was 150 MXN.

442621407.name: Nice experience
442621407.author: a TripAdvisor user
442621407.reviewBody: In the past centuries, Taxco was one of the biggest places famous for in Mexico. It is great part of this city history. It is realy worthy to discover Mina the Taxco. By the way - whole city is amazing - go thru this with old taxis - VW Beetle

366434659.name: Great mine tour
366434659.author: a TripAdvisor user
366434659.reviewBody: Heard this was a good tour and it was.\nWent down 4 stories on an elevator, hiked down to approx.150\'.\nGuide was very informative.There was a native show of how they mined hundreds of years ago. The mine is located directly under the Posada la Mission Hotel. At the end of the tour we were led to the gorgeous pool deck and a ice cold beer was included in the price of the tour...a 150 peso\'s..what a deal!!

365175504.name: Fantastic underground mine - a must see when visiting Taxco
365175504.author: a TripAdvisor user
365175504.reviewBody: Great tour for around 1 hour in a mine under a hotel.  Affordable prices - 150 pesos at the time we went.  There is the possiblity to rappel down it which would be great but either do the rappel or the tour as you see the same. Great guide - spoke spanish which i understand but i would recommend an english tour if i went again as he spoke very fast (I dont know if they have one).\nWarning.... DO NOT have the buffet breakfast in the hotel prior to the tour it was chaos, expensive and not great quality! People bulk ordered 14 quesadillas so you think you are behind 1 person but you are behind 14 and at least 4 people did this!

361641416.name: Mexico underground
361641416.author: a TripAdvisor user
361641416.reviewBody: This was really exciting. Going into the mine. I saw silver and gold stones shining and we went really deep. Also there is excellent guide to explain everything about the mine and Indians who were working here. On top of it all you get show in the mine how was ib the past with real people actors.

359406622.name: mining museum
359406622.author: a TripAdvisor user
359406622.reviewBody: It is a nice place with a nice atmosphere. It can be interesting for the children too. :)\nThe ticktet included a drink (beer or water or soft drink).

356601564.name: Tour of Mina de Taxco
356601564.author: a TripAdvisor user
356601564.reviewBody: I just finished the mine tour (Mina de Taxco) below the Hotel Posada de la Mision.  I really enjoyed the tour and recommend it for others.  The tour costs $150 Pesos and lasts about 40 minutes.  The price includes a free drink following the end of the tour.  I understand there is an option that includes rappelling down a shaft but that didn\'t interest me.  There didn\'t appear to be set start times for the tour, just whenever people showed up.  I was the only person in my group who didn\'t speak Spanish yet they still provided an English translator. The tour consists of a short elevator ride followed by a walk down into the mine and includes a reenactment of how they mined without metal tools or machines of any sort.   Apparently they uncovered the mine just a few years ago so the tour is relatively new and not widely known.  Nevertheless, the facility was safe and the tour was very well done.

345579863.name: Historical Tour with a touch of adventure
345579863.author: a TripAdvisor user
345579863.reviewBody:
We asked a local shop owner about going on a tour of silver mine in Taxco. We did not expect this lovely adventure. The tour was incredibly well done, it offered the history of the mine & of Taxco and we were delighted to learn how the native, Nahua's mined the precious medals. 

My sister is pregnant so we could not take the more adventurous tour which included repelling down into the mine, but with some preparation, I would explore that as an option. 

The tour ended with drinks at the pool and an amazing view of the mountains.

326978708.name: Interesting place!!
326978708.author: a TripAdvisor user
326978708.reviewBody: They discovered the mine 2 years ago under the Hotel Mision. Its a great experience for kids and adults. At the end you can get a free drink in the pool!

314489599.name: A must see in Taxco
314489599.author: a TripAdvisor user
314489599.reviewBody: Very nicely presented, fascinating geology and lovely setting. The mine is located literally under the hotel Posada de la Mision. The admission fee includes a drink at the hotel pool-side bar, where you can admire an impressive stone mozaic.\nThe mine is pre-Hispanic, not big but well preserved and presented. The guides are knowledgeable and very proud of their heritage. A must see in Taxco.

306128194.name: Silver production in Mexico
306128194.author: a TripAdvisor user
306128194.reviewBody: I liked to remind history face to face in this mine. What I dislike is that there is not enough publicity for this attraction

673755135.name: Great view
673755135.author: a TripAdvisor user
673755135.reviewBody: The cable car takes you from town to the Montetaxco Hotel and back. We have stayed at the hotel and it is a great way to get down to the town.

665555593.name: Part of being a Taxco tourist\u2026
665555593.author: a TripAdvisor user
665555593.reviewBody:
A bit pricy (by Mexican standards) for what you get but the view is great.  I did the one-way up (65 pesos) and then walked around the golf course and the Montetaxco Hotel which has been here for over 40 years!  Ended up enjoying a red wine at their restaurant overlooking the swimming pool and Taxco.  Good for sunset view.  The restaurant and hotel have great paintings and stainglass – worth seeing.

I walked all the way back to where I could catch a combi/bus to town (or a taxi for the less adventurous).  Many foreigners have homes up here (aka gringolandia)… 

If you are stuck at the top after the teleferico closes, the hotel can call you a taxi for an extra fee.  None of the taxis are that expensive in Taxco.

660260007.name: One Way Trip - Worth the Nice Experience
660260007.author: a TripAdvisor user
660260007.reviewBody:
At the zócalo plaza, we hired a taxi driver to take us to the Cristo and Teleférico. We bought a one way trip to come down in the teleférico. We asked the taxi driver to meet us at the bottom of the mountain. There is nothing there, just a few souvenir shops. The taxi driver can make you a deal by the hour. You can explore both places in 1.5 hours. The experience in the Teleférico and driving in the VW through the very narrow roads at the mountain is an experience not to be missed. The private tour becomes very inexpensive. Less than $12
The catch: the driver may tell you he knows where to buy cheap silver worked by the local artesans. Don’t accept to visit those shops or places. It will be a waste of time; their prices are not any cheaper. Just tell the driver: “No, no queremos comprar plata”. The driver will understand and will not insist!

Espectacular views from both places!

659711598.name: Worth taking for the view and seeing the hotel
659711598.author: a TripAdvisor user
659711598.reviewBody:
We took a collectivo bus that said Teleferico) on it to get there. Only 8 pesos. We then walked up to where we took the tram. Because we didnt know we could get a taxi from up there back to town we paid for the return trip. Found out once up there the hotel has set rates for taxis if you want to go back to town (only 55 pesos to get back to the zocolo). If we had known that we would have taken the tram one way (60 pesos) and then paid for a taxi to take us back to the zocalo (would gave been cheaper and another experience)

Hotel us beautiful and walking the grounds enjoyable.

Food prices were fair (no surprise taxes)

View from cable car was spectacular.

656414341.name: Worth the ride for the best photo ops of Taxco
656414341.author: a TripAdvisor user
656414341.reviewBody: Best way to get some great pics of Taxco, especially on the way down. Runs on demand so no wait time and a reasonable 95 pesos return. There isn\'t much at the top except the hotel. However the terrace is a perfect option for lunch with lovely views and not expensive.\n\nWe took a taxi to the telferico from the Zocalo for 35 pesos and then walked back as was only 20 minutes or so and nice way to see more of the town.

644091045.name: Worth the view
644091045.author: a TripAdvisor user
644091045.reviewBody: The cable car is efficient with lovely views of the city.\nOnce you get to the top there is a place where you can have a drink and the large hotel where the views are great

643904561.name: Excellent view while moving
643904561.author: a TripAdvisor user
643904561.reviewBody: The cableway has two main advantages if you are hosted at the Montetaxco Hotel. One it is quicker to get into town than riding a taxi. And you get a gorgeous view along the way. \nIf you are not staying at Montetaxco Hotel you can also try it one way or round trip to visit and enjoy the great views from above.\nThe gondolas are small (sit 4) but the service is reliable and friendly.

626788867.name: A must-see experience in Taxco
626788867.author: a TripAdvisor user
626788867.reviewBody: A great opportunity to experience beautiful views of the city. At the top is the Hotel Monte Taxco with its great dining and cocktail opportunities. The teleferico is the easiest way to visit Monte Taxco. Be sure to check the schedule because the cable car stops running early (maybe 7pm) during weekdays. Taxi service is always available from the desk of the hotel.

591644279.name: Beautiful views of Taxco and the surrounding mountains
591644279.author: a TripAdvisor user
591644279.reviewBody: We enjoyed touring the luxury resort hotel on the other end and the gorgeous scenery during the ride and at the hotel.

574093921.name: Much better to use the Teleferico than get a taxi
574093921.author: a TripAdvisor user
574093921.reviewBody: Use the Teleferico to get to the Hotel Montetaxco, much better than getting in a taxi.  Great views and it takes around 10 mins (meant to time it but forgot).  From memory it was around 70 peso per person.

573807716.name: Cable car with overvire
573807716.author: a TripAdvisor user
573807716.reviewBody: Cable car with splendid. Taxi from City center to the basis of the cable car costs 100 pesos. Cable car gives a beautiful overview of the City - remember your photo camera. Top point at the hotel gives acces to a view point as well - it is allowed to pass through the reception area of the hotel to get to a view point. Either take the cable car down again - or order a taxi to drive you down the Hill - try to request the taxi to stop at a viewpoint half down that also gives a good view/photo point.

569180776.name: if your in the hotel then do it, other wise dont
569180776.author: a TripAdvisor user
569180776.reviewBody: we stayed at MonteTaxco very nice and top hotel for the area, and the 95 pesos for the ride was not worth it, a taxi to downtown is 60 and if your take the ride, on the bottom you still have to get a cab to go anyware.  its not an atraction only if your a guest of the hotel. and they charge it separe, like a difrent co. even do it says on the the door Montetaxco teleferico.  witch is the teleferic for the hotel.. i get it its a unique entrance, but man do they need upgrading and new equipment, and the ride is expensive !

558435321.name: Fun way to spend 30 minutes
558435321.author: a TripAdvisor user
558435321.reviewBody: Takes about 10-15 min to reach the top. 95 pesos return for adults, 65 for kids under 10. You can get off at the top to wander the hotel/shops. Great views of Taxco.

558177489.name: Get a taxi
558177489.author: a TripAdvisor user
558177489.reviewBody: It\'s a great view from the hotel at the top over town and a great view for lunch.  However if you have been on cable cars before this one is pretty small.  The view as you go up is ok but it\'s best from the top anyway.

557180655.name: Get your camera\'s ready "Beautiful Views".
557180655.author: a TripAdvisor user
557180655.reviewBody: Nine of us took the tram (Telef\u00e9rico) to the Hotel MonteTaxco. The ride can be round trip (we took) or one way with taxi\'s in front of the Hotel or you can drive up the hill and ride the tram down.  There is steep walking up and down to the tram. The ride will hold 4 people and is not open air. It takes the tram about 10 minutes to reach the top. Once you arrive at the top you will have to walk up to the hotel and gift shop. The ride is very efficient, easy to get your ticket and quick to get onto the tram. Lots of beautifully views and we all enjoyed every minute of the ride.

550316414.name: Taxco must
550316414.author: a TripAdvisor user
550316414.reviewBody:
Amazing views. 

We opted for the round trip 

Adults $95 pesos 
Kids $65

Drops you at a taxi zone, taxi from here to the main church (Zocolo ) $30 pesos.  

Message me with questions would be glad to offer insight.

549034929.name: A legendary thing to do in Taxco
549034929.author: a TripAdvisor user
549034929.reviewBody: This gondola runs al the way to the top of the mountain where the Montetaxco hotel is. It is like 7 minute relaxing ride. You can ride it either up or down the hill. Ticket can be bought one or round trip.\nWe stayed at the Montetaxco hotel so we ride it for fun and as a transportation too!!

548646493.name: Fun ride with tremendous view
548646493.author: a TripAdvisor user
548646493.reviewBody: When my sister came to visit me in Taxco, I immediately thought of the teleferico. I had been wanting an excuse to take it up to the top of the hill overlooking Taxco.\nWe both enjoyed it very much, and loved the breath-taking views. We took it up to the top, and had a wonderful lunch at the hotel there, Hotel Monte Taxco. I highly recommend giving it a go.

545651106.name: Great views of the city
545651106.author: a TripAdvisor user
545651106.reviewBody: We\u2019ve made it our mission to visit every \u201cmagical\u201d town in Mexico, Taxco being high on our list.  The Teleferico \u201ccable car\u201d is a must do if you come here.  We stayed at the Montetaxco, the hotel that owns and manages the Teleferico.  The views are absolutely spectacular, especially the ride up at sundown.  It\u2019s definitely a must see in Taxco, and a very fun ride.

522124632.name: Free ride from MonteTaxco hotel
522124632.author: a TripAdvisor user
522124632.reviewBody: Nice view of Taxco from this teleferico! We actually got a free ride by staying at MonteTaxco hotel..

513207492.name: Great
513207492.author: a TripAdvisor user
513207492.reviewBody: There are not too many things to do in taxco so definitely you should go and do this activity. I recommend to take a taxi and go to the top then you do a tour in the hotel at the hill then only go down and enjoy the espectacular view. Everything is cheap even for Mexicans.\n\nEnjoy it.

512262180.name: Great!
512262180.author: a TripAdvisor user
512262180.reviewBody: We stayed at the hotel montetaxco at the top of the mountain, so the cableway was la most practical transport to get to the downtown area and back. The trip is exciting and offers a beautiful view of the city. If you\'re not staying in the hotel montetaxco, it\'s still a nice experience and there are little shops and places to have a beer at the top. The ride is 95 pesos round trip, or 65 one way per person.

495703019.name: Cable car
495703019.author: a TripAdvisor user
495703019.reviewBody: A cable car that takes you to MonteTaxco hotel. Very steep ride up and down. The day we went, it was cloudy and rainy, but still a great time.

493951448.name: Access to Monte Taxco and View of Town
493951448.author: a TripAdvisor user
493951448.reviewBody:
The Teleferico is a Swiss built gondola that takes you up a hillside to the Monte Taxco Inn.  It gives you views of the town and mountains as you ascend from the bottom to the top.

The cost is approximately USD5 per person round trip and they only take cash.

We went around 1pm midweek and found ourselves then dining on the terrace of the Monte Taxco Inn nearly alone.  While their lunch buffet was more money then in town at about USD11, it provided a good place to relax after a morning of touring.

We then took the gondola down and found a taxi back to the center of town.

489723054.name: Fun
489723054.author: a TripAdvisor user
489723054.reviewBody: its is fun, specially if you are staying at the Monte Taxco Hotel is a must. goes up and down the hill very quiet and nice ride spectacular views.

485986859.name: Nice views
485986859.author: a TripAdvisor user
485986859.reviewBody: To go from the city center to Montetaxco it is a nice ride - not spectacular but nice. From Montetaxco you have great views to the city. Our small daughter enjoyed the ride a lot.

476606823.name: Amazing views of an amazing little town
476606823.author: a TripAdvisor user
476606823.reviewBody:
Taxco ....
Quaint little Mexican town with lots of ups and downs walking on medieval style stone roads.   It is hard to get big or normal cars through to city center. So one option is getting dropped off half way to taking one of the Volkswagen Beatles taxi in to where you want to go.  The silver shops are great. Some are high end that have worked on reproduction of famous jewelry pieces such as those worn by Frida Khalo...and have won prizes.. Another option is getting a guide to take you to an underground silver market that had similar pieces for half the price and you can even negotiate... They especially start the important reductions when you try the ' walk away'.    There are also shops to get local embroidered clothes and limits shops with serving dishes.   There are plenty of restaurants in the town center.  I recommend getting a guide at the cathedral.  You can also take funicular to some spectacular hotel restaurants with amazing mountain views!    Overall, this place is worth the day trip.  If you are into holy. Celebrations of Holy Week before Easter...they do the stations of the cross with quite vivid personalities enacting even the sacrificial men who would hit and hurt themselves  on purpose. Or just come some day before holy Friday and see a photo exhibit I the main plaza in front of cathedral.

Funicular 

Very safe and also an important aspect of the visit to taxco.  Take it to get to wonderful restaurant hotel and spa resort monte taxco!!  Great areal views of taxco on the ride!

470033352.name: A must do!
470033352.author: a TripAdvisor user
470033352.reviewBody: The ride is short but you get a great view of the town. You\'ll find one of the most popular hotels in town, shopping area and art stores. It\'s worth the time. I recommend stopping by the stores outside the hotel for souvenir shipping.

457647319.name: Overrated if you are not staying at the hotel
457647319.author: a TripAdvisor user
457647319.reviewBody: If you are staying at the Monte Taxco hotel we do recommend taking the Telef\u00e9rico.  It will take you closer to the city and can walk to the main city center streets.  The second choice is take a taxi which will drop you at a closer destination or your car, if you brought one, but be ready to look out for parking centers because the town gets full in weekends. \nIf you are not staying at the hotel don\'t go.  It is just a trip to the hotel that do not offer activities or shops to non hotel customers. The views are unimpressive also so consider this as your last activities to go if you have time.

454753000.name: Beautiful City View
454753000.author: a TripAdvisor user
454753000.reviewBody: Getting here was easy, we took combi\'s everywhere for the most part of a Taxi if needed. The combi is less than a $1 and dropped us off at the end of the driveway that leads you up to the teleferico. When we got to the top we walked around the Montetaxco Hotel for a while. Took some pictures inside and outside as well. It was a good 2 hrs of our day or so.

445593024.name: Worth a one way trip
445593024.author: a TripAdvisor user
445593024.reviewBody: The view is excellent, and the experience is worth writing home about. I suggest taking the teleferico up in the late afternoon hours, then ordering drinks/eating your dinner at the restaurant "El Taxque\u00f1o" as the sun sets. This will allow you to see taxco in the daytime on your way up, the sunset, and finally the city lit up at night as you enjoy your dinner. The cocktail "Beso de Angel" is great!

438196754.name: Not a must, but if you have spare time
438196754.author: a TripAdvisor user
438196754.reviewBody: Definitely, there is no need to jump into it, but if you have time and want to rest the legs, it is an option. Safe ride.

420321701.name: Expensive and not the best view
420321701.author: a TripAdvisor user
420321701.reviewBody: Tickets are expensive and only 4pax in each cable car.  View is OK but far. Few things to do at the top

397483195.name: A most if you are visiting
397483195.author: a TripAdvisor user
397483195.reviewBody: is very enjoyable, I recommend to do at least two rounds, you must see the views when is almos the sunset

393149734.name: Nice view
393149734.author: a TripAdvisor user
393149734.reviewBody: Ir is a rife of some 5 minutos. You need to go through the hotel to se the vienes of the cita. it is a nice view although from the side of the city,, you can see the zocalo and all the small houses over the slope of the city.\n\nIt does not take more than 10 to 15 minutes.

380020651.name: Excellent aerial view from Taxco
380020651.author: a TripAdvisor user
380020651.reviewBody: The cable car runs from Monte Taxco hotel to the main highway 15 minutes walking from downtown. The price is affordable, $ 65 pesos per person each way or $ 95 two-ways.

367991895.name: Pesos better spent elsewhere
367991895.author: a TripAdvisor user
367991895.reviewBody: The gondola ride is scenic, but, like other reviewers, I expected more when we arrived at the top. A hotel, some houses, a small shop. Not even an obvious viewpoint. Would rather have spent the money on a taxi to the statue of Christ up on the other hilltop.

359146659.name: Fun way to reach Hotel
359146659.author: a TripAdvisor user
359146659.reviewBody: We were staying at the MonteTaxo Hotel close by the teleferico and we took a tour which included going back and forth on the cable car.  We felt very safe and it was a fun ride with great panoramic views.  If at the hotel, you will still need a taxi into downtown, but it\'s a fun diversion.

344402416.name: Not worth it
344402416.author: a TripAdvisor user
344402416.reviewBody: Its a cable car which will take you to the top of a mountain. There is an expensive hotel with its expensive bar and the 95 peso ticket for the cable car is not worth it. There is nothing on the top.

343776499.name: little swiss teleferico
343776499.author: a TripAdvisor user
343776499.reviewBody: I used this teleferico to commute between my hotel on the Montetaxco and the city. You get a nice view on Taxco and surrounding. Service is great.

340323681.name: the Lanscape is Amazing!
340323681.author: a TripAdvisor user
340323681.reviewBody: If you travel to Taxco you most have to take a ride to The Teleferico, is an  amazing experience!!  The Town is very cosy  people very warm,

317618429.name: Good views!
317618429.author: a TripAdvisor user
317618429.reviewBody: A bit expensive, but you get very good views of Taxco, plus when you reach the top, you can have a drink or a bite at sprawling Montetaxco hotel.

306772293.name: Not the best use of your money if you are on a budget
306772293.author: a TripAdvisor user
306772293.reviewBody: It was okay but it only takes you to the hotel on top of the hill, which really isn\'t that much to see, and it\'s costs a lot for such a short ride

289258010.name: It was OK
289258010.author: a TripAdvisor user
289258010.reviewBody: The view itself was fine. As you go up the rail, the beautiful city of Taxco can be seen. The main concern that I had was that upon arriving to the top, there is nothing to do. I was expecting the top to be full of people and stores and perhaps other things to do. While there were a couple stores, they had no foot traffic at all. Mostly employees working.\n\nIn my own personal opinion, Ill rate it as a 6 out of 10.

281163645.name: Great panoramic view, however it\'s overpriced. I recommend....
281163645.author: a TripAdvisor user
281163645.reviewBody: There are two great ways to see Taxco. One is the "Telerferico" (the cable car) however you will have to pay. It\'s located by "Los Arcos" and you can take a taxi or a combi (collective taxi van) that indicates "Arcos" and you walk up to the entrance from there. It\'s 90 MXN$ to ride. It takes you pretty high to the top of the hotel "MonteTaxco", there\'s not really much to do there unless you want to grab a michelada or go to the hotel\'s overpriced bar. The view is a great panoramic view although it\'s a short (about 5 minutes) ride up. I recommend going for the sunset to really enjoy it. The other is by climbing to the highest point in Taxco where there is the statue of the Christ. This is a bit a challenge if you\'re not in good condition. It can be a steep long walk. You can ask one of the taxi\'s to take you up and down if you\'re not up for it. It\'s worth it because it\'s a beautiful view for the sunrise and a great spot to take some pictures. For more recommendation and reviews on Taxco: http://cocinax.com/travel/taxco-guerrero

272194585.name: Nice View
272194585.author: a TripAdvisor user
272194585.reviewBody: Ok... it might not be the best view in the world but it is definetly totally worth the ride. and if you are in the mood to be romantic, it\u00b4s a nice place to go.

271864676.name: Not the best cable car I\'ve ever been on
271864676.author: a TripAdvisor user
271864676.reviewBody: A fairly short cable car which appears to be mainly for people working and staying at the hotel on the hill.  The view is good but you can get the same view from many other places.  We stayed at the Mountainview Hotel so tried the Teleferico as a way of getting to town but was quite expensive so only did it the once.

269741253.name: Nothing special
269741253.author: a TripAdvisor user
269741253.reviewBody: Defenitely I lost my money because the view is not nice or special. It is better to walk aroun the amazing strets.

264748119.name: Wonderful experience
264748119.author: a TripAdvisor user
264748119.reviewBody: Though not for the faint-hearted... but if you can defeat your fear of hights, it\'s worth it. Faster than taking the car uphill too...

258469271.name: Great way to view the City and a gorgeous resort.
258469271.author: a TripAdvisor user
258469271.reviewBody: We took the Teleferico mainly because it was there.  It turned out to be quite the experience--and I mean that in a good way.  The Teleferico goes to a beautiful resort on the top of the hill, and we got out and walked around it--it was quiet, which the City is not--and quite lovely.  The views up and back, and from the resort, were terrific.  And it wasn\'t even very scary!

252886668.name: A special and different view of Taxco
252886668.author: a TripAdvisor user
252886668.reviewBody: Every visit to Taxco ..has to have this experience...The weather was excellent ..we sat on the terrace of the a Hotel and had a delicious lunch..with a superb view...Even the little shop was good for browsing and shopping for some colourfull Mexican tops.

250639341.name: Looking down.
250639341.author: a TripAdvisor user
250639341.reviewBody: This is the best way to see the city all at once. Taxco is an incredible mountain city. To see it from the air is quite unique. Although the ride isn\'t that long, it is well worth it to look down on this beautiful city.

205397093.name: Expensive
205397093.author: a TripAdvisor user
205397093.reviewBody: At around 90 pesos round trip, this ride is pricey.  There isn\'t much to do up top and the only view to be had requires entering the big hotel and walking through to the pool area where you can take in the vista or buy a drink at the restaurant.  The ride itself is fun and kids would enjoy it, but the ticket price is steep for what you get.

197108777.name: Taxco - A Gem To Be Experienced
197108777.author: a TripAdvisor user
197108777.reviewBody: We visited today the Pueblo Magico of Taxco, the Silver Capitol of Mexico.  We traveled by bus from Cuernavaca to Taxco, using Estrella Blanca Bus Line.  Busses leave every hour from their terminal on Morelos St. in Cuernavaca; the price of a ticket is 80 pesos.  Taxco is probably my favorite Pueblo Magico visited so far.  Be patient in making your silver purchases, as there are more than 300 silver shops in Taxco.

580022760.name: Good spot to buy good price silver
580022760.author: a TripAdvisor user
580022760.reviewBody: The market and some of the smaller stores around it are a good place to buy good price silver.\n\nBest to shop around and don\'t forget to bargain. You can usually get 20% off the initial price without trying too hard. Mist of them quote 925 grade silver.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

570294183.name: One of the most beautiful places in Mexico
570294183.author: a TripAdvisor user
570294183.reviewBody: The town of Taxco is fabulous, picturesque to a fault. The small restaurant right next to the cathedral (on the left) has the best pozzole  I have ever had. The shops great,strolling amazing.Parking is a problem so be conscious of that.Locals are very friendly.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

557559482.name: Wonderful area
557559482.author: a TripAdvisor user
557559482.reviewBody: We went to Taxco with family city itself worth seeing silver shops are so much in diversity you find anything for every budget

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

549035518.name: Huge place to walk around
549035518.author: a TripAdvisor user
549035518.reviewBody: This market place is huge!!!! But be careful because not all of it is silver so yo have to be sure that what your are buying is silver. If not sure, better get advice for a local person, let\u2019s say someone from the hotel you are staying. Also, if you what to be SURE about the silver, have someone take you to a local workshop. That\u2019s silver 100%

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

504331546.name: Good deals!!
504331546.author: a TripAdvisor user
504331546.reviewBody: Really good deal and nice design on jewelry!Most of the time you can find people around town who will take you to the factories !

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

476607440.name: Get a guide...compare shops with underground silver market
476607440.author: a TripAdvisor user
476607440.reviewBody: The silver shops are great. Some are high end that have worked on reproduction of famous jewelry pieces such as those worn by Frida Khalo...and have won prizes.. Another option is getting a guide to take you to an underground silver market that had similar pieces for half the price and you can even negotiate... They especially start the important reductions when you try the \' walk away\'.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

450042866.name: Great quality and price
450042866.author: a TripAdvisor user
450042866.reviewBody: It is the best place to shop ... one stop shop great prices and great quality silver ... you will not find cheaper prices of silver then in taxco ! So shop and have fun !

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

430704877.name: Lovely area
430704877.author: a TripAdvisor user
430704877.reviewBody: Really enjoyed my time spent in Taxco. Really lovely place with lots of silver shops. Lots of places to sit and relax aswell.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

390349507.name: Great souvenirs
390349507.author: a TripAdvisor user
390349507.reviewBody: Yep, I\'m not into shopping experiences, but the one in Taxco is worth it as the silver is cheap here. They sell both jewellery and all kinds of pots, plates, chandeliers, etc., anything silver, name it, they have it.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

389487039.name: 2nd visit in 3 months
389487039.author: a TripAdvisor user
389487039.reviewBody: This was my second visit in several months, and again, I was in awe!  I bought earrings, some earring and bracelet sets, and a GORGEOUS bracelet that I just adore.  Prices are great!  Beware of the outside vendors around the market, and beware of extremely low prices-those items may not be real silver.  There is a place right on the main street that will test silver for you to make sure it\'s real.  Always get a card from the vendor so you know where you bought it, because believe me, it\'s wall to wall silver.  There is a decent, clean place to eat inside the 3 story building that has sliver, and it\'s tasty and reasonable.  Will return again next time I\'m in Mexico!

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

351919476.name: Fantastic
351919476.author: a TripAdvisor user
351919476.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Mexico many times, but never had been to Taxco.  I went on a Saturday, took a bus from Mexico City.  It\'s about a 2 1/2 hour trip one way.  The main street in Taxco is lined with vendors. Do not go to the shops near the bus stops.  Prices are outrageous.  Best advice is to go to the Mercado.  They have better quality pieces and better prices.  If you don\'t like crowds, then this may not be the place for you.  Space is at a premium, and crowds are at a maximum.  The market is a 3 story building.  I couldn\'t take pictures because I was too busy looking for my special pieces!  Also be aware that some of the street vendors do sell pieces at a much cheaper price, but these are not silver.  They are what is known to the Mexican\'s as "alpaca", and isn\'t true silver.  Next time I visit Mexico, this will definitely be a planned day trip.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

258258761.name: A gorgeous, picturesque mountainside town with nice views from the hilltop and a massive variety of silver.
258258761.author: a TripAdvisor user
258258761.reviewBody: Had a quick one day trip to Taxco on our way south and all worked out great. The town is on a hillside so lots of up and down with the walking but this gives it a great appearance if you climb or take a taxi/combo to the top of the town (climbing: 45-50mins moderate/difficult) (transport: public one is cheap but you have to do a small bit of walking, but get a private VW beetle and you will pay several times more).\nLoved walking around the silver markets and seeing the massive variety of jewellery and more. Worth going into some of the more expensive shops and asking to see the artefacts they make each year for the silverware competitions. Lovely town with a nice relaxed atmosphere. Have to spend an hour or two around the square for drinks and/or food soaking up the atmosphere.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

249701286.name: Great silver pieces!
249701286.author: a TripAdvisor user
249701286.reviewBody: You can find anything and the prices are so cheap, great art work in an affordable price, look around first because when you just buy something in the next store for sure you find something else that caught your eye.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

197184801.name: This market is open on Saturdays and Sundays and has a great variety of silver items for sale
197184801.author: a TripAdvisor user
197184801.reviewBody: You really have to have the time to go through so many stalls in these street market to find what you really want.  You can also bargain with your seller but up to a point.  Quality of the merchandise is very wide but more on the lower scale though you might find some unique silver pieces by some young silversmiths.  I heard the unconfirmed rumor that some of the silver trinkets for sale are now made in and imported from China so be aware of that possible threat --after all, the Chinese are tricky enough to copy Mexican silver designs as they have done with some of the Mexican Talavera pottery already.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

183722902.name: Read this!leelo
183722902.author: a TripAdvisor user
183722902.reviewBody: If u want to buy first walk around and compare prices. Under The hill u can see a small comunitty of indians selling curios ask to them wherw u can buy silver. I went with my husbabd walking and ask to indian we buy beautiful silver cheaper and its good silver!Look for non beauty store if u need cheap prices.\n

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

167574871.name: too much is not enough
167574871.author: a TripAdvisor user
167574871.reviewBody: The beetle cars are going slow, and nearby lots of silver handcroft, lots of people. Mostly You buy copies in quantities, but so beautiful just to be there to look at the people although You would not buy what You see. For quality You have to go to the installed shops or You are lucky to find the one....

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

148892944.name: Buyer beware
148892944.author: a TripAdvisor user
148892944.reviewBody:
If you want to admire an original handmade and quality piece visit the designer boutiques or museums to appreciate the true art of jewelry making.  
Unfortunatly, many small merchants in Taxco are not honest and sell jewelry that is not silver, claiming that it is.  Also most of what is sold in Taxco can be purchased  in other Mexican cities as they are mass produced, shipped and marketed just about everywhere.  Be sure to shop around and see what prices are like, and be prepared to bargain with the seller. 
The cooperative near the market or zocalo is my example.  I bought three rings all stamped 925 silver, got a receipt, only to find out that one started to tarnish and rust when I got home. To return the item implies mailing the ring back to the merchant for a refund that may or may not be given. 
It is unfortunate that some of the dealers and merchants are killing their own business by sabotaging their own livelyhood.  With Internet and websites such as Tripadvisor, the consumer is more aware of what options are available and what other people's experiences were.  Be careful when buying silver, ask the merchant to show you the cedrtification stamp, ask for a receipt with an email address and phone number.  
You can always try putting a magnet to the item, if it is pure silver it should not stick to the magnet.

itemReviewed.name: Mercado de Plata o Tianguis Sabatino

address.streetAddress: Calle de Mora Barrio de Mora

673755729.name: Beautiful views
673755729.author: a TripAdvisor user
673755729.reviewBody: Every time we visit Taxco, we go up to Cristo. It has such beautiful views of the city. Cristo is getting a little old and the last time there, one of his hands had fallen off. Still a muct see.

665530842.name: Already lost a body part!!!
665530842.author: a TripAdvisor user
665530842.reviewBody:
Even though it was only built in 2002, this stone statue of Christ has already lost its left hand.  Locals say it happened on a windy day.  

Excellent view from here.  Free to enter, you only have to pay for a combi (small van/bus) or taxi to get here.  The ride itself is part of the experience as the street is really narrow, windy, and steep.  Hold on tight!  

Unfortunately, the place is not well kept up and the base of the statue is filled with graffiti as are the walls around the space.  

On the day I came up, three cops in uniform, were drinking beer in the shade…  Mexico is quite different that way.  

There is a small restaurant next to this place so you can enjoy, food, a drink, and the view.

662434574.name: THE CHRIST OF THE TOP
662434574.author: a TripAdvisor user
662434574.reviewBody: This Christ is located in the Center of Atache and is 5 meters tall.\nIt\'s considered the most popular view in Taxco. Definitely it\'s a place where you can take photos and appreciate the view.

647850158.name: A 2 hour hike
647850158.author: a TripAdvisor user
647850158.reviewBody: We felt like getting some exercise so hiking up was a great way to see Taxco and The Cristo statue.  There were lots of surprises along the way, we purchased manderines from a truck along the way as well as bananas and stopped in at a Panderia for a donut to share on our way back down. \nIf you are fit and have good runners I would recommend the hike but you have to have the time and early morning is best before it gets hot. \nThe view is worth it ! I can also take a taxi up which is what most people do.  Great photo and video ops.

645551486.name: Broken hand doesn\'t diminish its beauty
645551486.author: a TripAdvisor user
645551486.reviewBody: We love the view from here and of this. Although one hand had fallen off, it is still on the ground there to see. This statue is amazing and a must-see for all.

644094078.name: Wonderful views
644094078.author: a TripAdvisor user
644094078.reviewBody: The taxi ride is hair raising, but worth it. We got our driver to wait for us as we were not sure about going downtown.\nViews were great and not too many people.

619900650.name: fun hike to the top
619900650.author: a TripAdvisor user
619900650.reviewBody: if you like walking, this is a fun walk up the hill.  the path is relatively clear with a few signs for Christo.  you will walk through a few neighborhoods along the way.  once you get to the top there is a small food stall where they sell sweet treats and drinks with chairs and tables.  if you are too tired to walk back, there are taxis ready to drive you back to zocalo.  and boy, being in that old WV through the steep hills through tight turns and narrow streets was a fun experience too!  i loved it  :)

603681611.name: Wow A View Not To Be Missed
603681611.author: a TripAdvisor user
603681611.reviewBody: Visited Taxco from Mexico City with MexCity Tours. Leo wanted us to experience a different type of ride up narrow winding roads to a lookout. He ordered Volkswagen Beetle taxi\'s to take us all for this fun scenic ride up to Taxco\'s Nazereno "Catholic Saint". Wow this is something to see. What a beautiful view of Taxco. Then the Volkswagen Beetle Taxi took us back down to the centre square of Taxco called the Zocalo.\n

593525383.name: A good place
593525383.author: a TripAdvisor user
593525383.reviewBody: You must go there!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!\nIs a good place to visit, you Will see a great view over there \nAmazing photos

573810149.name: Beautiful view over the City/sourroundings
573810149.author: a TripAdvisor user
573810149.reviewBody: Recommend to take the small VW taxi\u2019s to the top. Rewarded with a beautiful view. Possible to buy som liquid and food/ice at the top. We then walked down - no issues in that. Took only short time - possibility to take a break at the middle where a small and old Church is located. Small shops on the way down offers both liquid, food and souvenirs. Fun to watch the almost acrobatic movements of the taxi\u2019s coming through the very narrow streets.

569589601.name: Best vieww
569589601.author: a TripAdvisor user
569589601.reviewBody: The greatrst area to see, But a little difficult to get, this town is small, But its constructed over hills

567475442.name: Nice view to watch the city,like a mini Rio
567475442.author: a TripAdvisor user
567475442.reviewBody: Its fun to take VW Beetle taxi to climb the hill and take some pictures of Taxco.Nice view to watch the city,like a mini Rio. Cool 10 mins stop over.

566353576.name: What a view!
566353576.author: a TripAdvisor user
566353576.reviewBody: Take a ride up the mountain in one of the white beetles. Admire their driving skills. Enjoy the view of the city and cool breeze. It gives you the best view of the whole city! Possibility to enjoy a drink at the top.

565797145.name: Overlooking the city and offering his protection
565797145.author: a TripAdvisor user
565797145.reviewBody: Took a taxi up to Cristo, this monument is quite impressive. You feel so small when standing at the base. You can see how he was made in sections, our taxi driver did let us know that the concrete to create this monument was hauled up by hand. You tend to appreciate the work and love that created this monument. The taxi driver also said that the head was broken off during an earthquake and was replaced, so now Cristo looks a little more to the side. From this monument, you can overlook the city of Taxco and see an outline of a heart, what a view!

550382077.name: Saturday visit
550382077.author: a TripAdvisor user
550382077.reviewBody:
Great view the taxi took us right to this location and waited for us as we looked and took pictures, afterwards took us to the Zocalo, the plaza where the church is Prisca, all for 50 pesos. 

This is definitely a must see and do, but the visit is relatively quick. 

There is a snack vendor there sells sliced fruit, I only saw pineapple and other snacks  , FYI. 

Very safe and beautiful view.

544107377.name: Nice if you are catholic
544107377.author: a TripAdvisor user
544107377.reviewBody: Access is a little complicated, few places to park, nice view of the town from the top. Big sculpture.

539501114.name: Great climb and views!
539501114.author: a TripAdvisor user
539501114.reviewBody: We walked all the way up here from the zocalo and it was quite a hike.  But it\'s easy to find, you just keep going up, up, up and a lot of the time El Cristo is in view.  The views from up here are amazing!  If you want some good exercise, then this is the thing to do in Taxco.

511994300.name: Great view.
511994300.author: a TripAdvisor user
511994300.reviewBody: This place offers the best view of the town, but there\'s not much else to do; you can admire the view and snap some great pictures but in average you will not be here more than 20 minutes. It\'s hard to get therw driving, the best way to arrive is by taxi. There is no entrance fee.

502251331.name: Amazing view
502251331.author: a TripAdvisor user
502251331.reviewBody: The view of the city is amazing from on top. .. you can see all Taxco and if the weather is good you can see all the surroundings mountains

498715345.name: What a walk
498715345.author: a TripAdvisor user
498715345.reviewBody: It took me more than 1/2 hour walking up to the monument they are many stairs to climb up. The view is nice. The view was stunning seeing the whole town.

495704019.name: Must see
495704019.author: a TripAdvisor user
495704019.reviewBody: You can see Christo from everywhere in Taxco. Up high on the mountain, with wonderful views. The cab ride is an experience with all the narrow and winding streets.

473157137.name: It\'s not Rio de Janeiro.
473157137.author: a TripAdvisor user
473157137.reviewBody: It\'s not Rio de Janeiro - don\'t expect mind blowing panorama. It\'s just a panoramic point with a nice view, perfect place to start walking throught the winding Taxco streets. The best way to get there is to catch VW taxi as it\'s quite uphill. Ride through the very steep and narrow streets to the statue is fun itself.

466380352.name: A must visit location with the best view.
466380352.author: a TripAdvisor user
466380352.reviewBody: Our driver took us here in his vehicle but given a chance I would rather climb from the city center to see this beautiful monument. The views from the hill are breathtaking. Great panoramic view of the city of Taxco and vicinity!.

464494718.name: Stunnig views
464494718.author: a TripAdvisor user
464494718.reviewBody: Amazing views from Taxco at this spot. One tip is to get a taxi up there and request the taxi driver to wait to bring you back down the mountain. There are very few services at the top, there is 1 store but it was closed when we visited. Beautiful views of Taxco though and the surrounding mountains

464064607.name: What a view!
464064607.author: a TripAdvisor user
464064607.reviewBody: We took a "vocho" Volkswagen bug taxi to and from the zocalo to the monument. Before getting in the taxi, Ask the price for a return fare including about 10 minutes at the top for photos. It will be around 100 to 150 pesos total. You\'ll be impresses with the view of the area in and around Taxco. The taxi ride up and back is an adrenaline rush as drivers maneuver the hills and narrow streets.

459052878.name: For the Absolute Best City Views...!
459052878.author: a TripAdvisor user
459052878.reviewBody: For the absolute best city views of Taxco, make the effort and hike (or take a taxi) up to this statue! If you hike it, be careful as the streets are very narrow and cars will be passing by less than an arms length away. If you get a ride, pay close attention to the little amount of space left when two vehicles pass each other. The journey up there is as much a part of the experience as it is once you finally arrive. Once up top, the entire city and the surrounding areas are all visible and make for wonderful backdrops for all of your pictures. I promise, you will not be disappointed.

456692662.name: A view from the top
456692662.author: a TripAdvisor user
456692662.reviewBody: I visited this beautiful city because I do know people who live there. So getting here we parked and walked up, but there are plenty of taxis who will take you up there and even a few at the top you who are waiting to give rides as well. We took a little lunch with us and ate some tacos de chuleta from a restaurant located in la plazuela and a big 3 liter of Yoli. There was a taxi driver there who was offering to take all of our pictures for us and he did know all the best angles so we let him and then tipped him a few pesos also. The view of city from up here even during the day is beautiful. Definitely recommend this while you are visiting.

442028829.name: Wow, what a view!!
442028829.author: a TripAdvisor user
442028829.reviewBody:
We had a very entertaining drive up the mountain in a taxi (130mxn from and to the Saturday tianguis, with the driver waiting to take us back down). 

The Cristo is pretty impressive, but as noted by others the view is amazing. 

Our taxi driver set us up for photos "hugging" the Cristo, "holding hands" with the Cristo, and "holding" the Cathedral. That was fun to do and they came out nice.

416403767.name: Walk up to Cristo
416403767.author: a TripAdvisor user
416403767.reviewBody: I was living close to Zocalo. It was fun walking the steps through the town Zocalo. Great views of the city along the way. of course Cristo is maginificient.. dont miss it.

404919271.name: Worth it for the view and ride up there,
404919271.author: a TripAdvisor user
404919271.reviewBody: Take a VW taxi up and back (160 pesos round trip) for a hair-raising ride, many Mexican stand-offs with other vehicles.  You are rewarded by the imposing statue and stunning views of this lovely city.

397704872.name: Worth a look!
397704872.author: a TripAdvisor user
397704872.reviewBody: Found a taxi that brought us up to the Christo.  We also went to see the amazing waterfalls nearby with the taxi driver.  Old VW beetle up and down the narrow, winding roads. Such a good time!

385490281.name: Rio de Janeiro, San Sebasti\u00e1n , Taxco
385490281.author: a TripAdvisor user
385490281.reviewBody: We didn\'t expect to find a monument to Christ at the rambling town of Taxco but it is well worth the visit for the sensational view and the exciting method of getting there. \nWhilst there is the option of taking the cable car to Cristo, a much more entertaining method is to take a taxi .. VW beetles! Squeeze in the back seat and enjoy the bug traversing tight corners through the single lane streets that somehow manage to accommodate traffic going both directions with a lot of good humored  beeping and holding your breath as you pass other vehicles. \nThe drive was the highlight of the day!

380023367.name: Another panoramic view of Taxco
380023367.author: a TripAdvisor user
380023367.reviewBody: The highest lookout point in town. Great view of the city and surroundings. Many people taking pictures and it is on the way to other attractions like the Cacalotengo waterfalls and the Blue Basin.

374592057.name: Must see views of Taxco.
374592057.author: a TripAdvisor user
374592057.reviewBody: If you\'re in Taxco you simply must catch a cab to the top of the mountain and look over the town. You really can get an idea of how the town is perched on the edge of a mountain. The statue is huge and beautiful too. If you\'re feeling energetic you can walk back down or just catch another cab. You will be able to take some awesome pictures from up there. We\'ve been to Taxco twice and have enjoyed it more each time. Check it out!

593527110.name: A must to do!!!
593527110.author: a TripAdvisor user
593527110.reviewBody:
A great place to refresh!
You can take a lovely tour in the Nature!
You Will see and amazing landscape, bring a trekking shoes and a wey suit
Is easy and cheaper if you Rent a car, sadly the tours are expensive and you can not spend the time you want there

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Km 136, Casino de la Union, Texcaltitla, Mex.

675534230.name: Must see! Great non touristy stop.
675534230.author: a TripAdvisor user
675534230.reviewBody: What I loved about Taxco and Mexico City is that they are not very touristy. There is so much authenticity in the architecture, people and streets of this country. We visited the Zocalo of Taxco in the summer of 2009 and were shocked by its natural splendour and beauty. There was also a girl who was having her Quincienara at the church and we got some cool pictures of that. All and all, great place to shop and wander.

673756051.name: Nice
673756051.author: a TripAdvisor user
673756051.reviewBody: On week-ends very busy with local people. The church is great to see. there are many restaurants and silver shops around the square.

672178002.name: Fun place to wander & shop
672178002.author: a TripAdvisor user
672178002.reviewBody: This town was one of three \u2018silver cities\u2019, known for mining and production of silver products.  It is being preserved architecturally, and has a huge assortment of shops.  It is located on the side of a mountain, and traffic is restricted, so it\u2019s best to take a taxi to the town square, walk around and then walk down.  Other than constant haranguing of sales people, it was an interesting and picturesque place to visit.

665568807.name: Great contrast between the zocalo and the rest of the city of Taxco
665568807.author: a TripAdvisor user
665568807.reviewBody:
In general, the people of Taxco are quite subdued, quiet, and restrained compared to all other towns I have visited in 22 states in Mexico.  I don’t know why that is and I have many theories but what is fascinating is that they seem to come to life when they are in the zocalo.  Great central place to watch people interact or talk to the locals (should you speak Spanish).  It takes them a while to warm up but once they do, they are full of information and fun.  

The downsides are all the vehicles that keep moving around, making it very smelly and noisy as well as the constant vendors approaching you.  Once you develop a feel for how to handle them, you can relax a bit, but it takes a while to learn that.    

Justice is done very quickly here.  I watched a guy being beaten up severely by two other guys.  He had attempted to steal someone’s watch and was caught.  He was swiftly driven off in the back of a truck by the police.  None of the locals seemed to think anything about this – normal way of taking justice into their own hands.

663604707.name: full of life
663604707.author: a TripAdvisor user
663604707.reviewBody: heart of old Taxco. a  mining town.a lovely garden in zocalo where you can hang out. all very cheap so have a drink and enjoy

656159630.name: Fun
656159630.author: a TripAdvisor user
656159630.reviewBody: Fun place to sit and watch the world go by.  The plaza is well used by the locals...particularly enjoyed seeing mothers bring their children after school.

654818477.name: Extremely Active
654818477.author: a TripAdvisor user
654818477.reviewBody:
We were there for dinner and the next day
1. From the perfect seat on a balcony overlooking Zocalo we had dinner while many people danced to excellent drumming (Friday)
2. During the next day (Saturday) the place was extremely active with crafts people selling and a dance group dancing
3. This is the “center” of town as there is no other area for a big group to gather
4. This is small Zocalo compared to Puebla or Cuernavaca

645591557.name: Lively Place
645591557.author: a TripAdvisor user
645591557.reviewBody: We loved walking around the zocalo in the evenings.  We were there on a weekend and there was so much going on in the Santa Preista Square.  There seemed to always be vendors selling their products and lots of benches to sit and people-watch if you got tired of walking the town.  We wanted a private city tour in "English" and right in front of the Santa Preista Chruch at the zocalo, there was a guide named Stefano who talked great English (one of the only English speaking guides in Taxco, I\'m told) and he took us to all the high points of the town.  He took us through three churches and showed us many sights and took us to Cristo Monumental, and some silver mines; told us about the history of the town and showed us some mosaic work, etc.  If you\'re interested in a private tour, go to the Santa Preista Church at the Zocalo and ask around.  It was great and very informative.  Stefano charged us (I THINK) 600 pesos for four or five hours for three of us.  We enjoyed the tour so much, we each gave him 600 apiece.  Great day.  The zocalo is definitely a place not to miss, especially at night!

645550880.name: Love this square
645550880.author: a TripAdvisor user
645550880.reviewBody: We spend Saturday night enjoying all the festivities and vendors here. There was music, floats, and all sorts of fun. This is one of Mexico\'s most beautiful squares, especially on a weekend evening.

634275011.name: Busy, pretty place
634275011.author: a TripAdvisor user
634275011.reviewBody: The main irritation of this plaza is that the collectives are constantly pulling around the streets creating traffic, and the vendors out number the people about 2 to one, and they are constantly asking for you to buy something even if you are mid-conversation, or listening to someone talking.  Yet is is a pretty square and the town is charming.

626795117.name: A beautifully ornate church at the Zocolo
626795117.author: a TripAdvisor user
626795117.reviewBody: One of the most ornate churches I have seen in Mexico (and there are thousands). Located in the heart of town. Extensive use of silver throughout.

603687911.name: Wonderful Place For A Stroll
603687911.author: a TripAdvisor user
603687911.reviewBody: Visited Taxco from Mexico City with Mexcity Tours. We had an hour and half to explore on our own the area of the Zocalo. What a lovely place to enjoy. The Zocalo is surrounded by many shops, Santa Prisca Church and the very interesting winding narrow roads going up to the hills filled with vendors selling their wares, food and souvenirs. It is even fun to watch all the vehicules trying to manoevre down those narrow winding roads leading to main circle around the Zocalo. In the Zocalo there is alot of things going on. Now the Zocalo is not very big-no where near the size of Mexico City or Acapulco. But it is very pretty and quaint. A lot of people just sitting around on the benches, with some vendors walking around selling souvenirs or selling snacks like churros. There was even going on while we were there a few shows in the square-a folkloric dance group and a fashion show of some comic book characters

594431603.name: Gird yourself to endure constant sales pitches
594431603.author: a TripAdvisor user
594431603.reviewBody: Zocalo is no place to relax. That\u2019s fine. It\u2019s a hub of energy and its spokes reach up the ascending cobblestone walkways that encircle the central kiosk. If it\u2019s a tradition to sell wares in the Zocalo then simply accept it. At every turn there\u2019s a new vendor selling trinkets and souvenirs. Unless you duck into a storefront or restaurant there\u2019s no relief from the encounters. The same goes for the solicitations to enter the silver shops. I couldn\u2019t figure it out but there were also quasi-tour guides who intercepted us inside the church and guided us, and followed us, to certain landmarks. Were we supposed to tip them regardless of taking their advice? I don\u2019t know. I was with two friends and sometimes found myself uncharacteristically shielding myself behind them. As I said, take it for what it\u2019s worth. Do research before shopping for silver there to know which are both legitimate retailers and fair negotiators. I couldn\u2019t tell. My friends wanted me to purchase something after they filled their bags with wares so they talked me into buying an embroidered peasant blouse from a shop off the main streets. We were told with great confidence that it was \u2018hecho en Mexico.\u2019 Our laughter must still be echoing in the valleys as we drove away from Taxco and I read the label \u2018Made in India.\u2019 Snookered. My friend, a Mexican native, explained that the Indian factories bought up the patterns and designs of Mexican clothing, make them by factory machine in India, and they export them to Mexico. It\u2019s a shame. It wasn\u2019t much money and I helped the local economy, I guess, but I didn\u2019t feel satisfied that I traveled that deep into Mexico only to buy an Indian-made blouse and avoid buying silver because I felt like I was being shaken down. It\u2019s a lovely Spanish colonial village so perhaps that should be the point of your trip, not shopping. There\u2019s no lie about how beautiful the village is and how interesting its heritage as a home for writers since the 16th century.

593522966.name: A good place to hang out
593522966.author: a TripAdvisor user
593522966.reviewBody: Just a relax place to walk and spend tome with your family , there is a Lot of places to este around

580023366.name: It\'s a nice small little square
580023366.author: a TripAdvisor user
580023366.reviewBody: It\'s a small nice little square that is nice to see but nothing really special. You\'ll probably pass by it going to and from the Cathedral or Silver Market in any case.

574094212.name: Busy little Square with loads of VW Beetles!
574094212.author: a TripAdvisor user
574094212.reviewBody: Taxco runs loads of white VW beetles as taxis (so they are small and are limited on size for carrying people and bags - around 30 pesos to get you around the town) so you will often see a circle of white VW beetles going around the Zocalo.  Plenty of restaurants to eat and drink as is typical for the Zocalos.

570159580.name: Picture-Perfect
570159580.author: a TripAdvisor user
570159580.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful little towns I\'ve ever visited - perched on a mountainside, with white buildings, red roofs and winding, cobblestone streets. It is a pleasure just to walk and visit the various stores full of silver goods and restaurants with good food. This would be an ideal place for a lazy get-away.

569588964.name: Tris is one of the reasons to be a m\u00e1gic town
569588964.author: a TripAdvisor user
569588964.reviewBody: Geouges chuch, very detaild, big , the Z\u00f3calo has plenty of areas to eat, shop, and the most walk, there Are many silver shops

569181057.name: great little town lots to offer visitors
569181057.author: a TripAdvisor user
569181057.reviewBody: i really like this little town with tons of visitors, no place for a car, only walking up and down lots of guides to show you stuff and nice atmosfere i would come back for a 2 days at most.

567471504.name: Nice little sqaure
567471504.author: a TripAdvisor user
567471504.reviewBody: Not very big but it\'s crowded and seems fun. you can wander around and drink coffee from 2nd floor bar and buy some silver.

565796488.name: Open for shopping any time of the day
565796488.author: a TripAdvisor user
565796488.reviewBody: There are vendors every day walking the zocalo showing their wares. I loaded up on the colorful weaved baskets and am now enjoying these bright colors in my home. There are restaurants that you can sit and enjoy a drink where you have a birds eye view of the city. This is a beautiful city and is worth seeing if you are either taking a day trip or staying for a few days.

562820913.name: Beautiful plaza.
562820913.author: a TripAdvisor user
562820913.reviewBody: Too many cars and pollution on the city center... need to wear a mask...\ud83d\ude01\nIt\u2019s a pity for such a beautiful town.\nSomething has to be done \u2705

561825755.name: Liked it alot
561825755.author: a TripAdvisor user
561825755.reviewBody: The Zocalo is a very comfortable and welcoming site for tourists visiting this city. \n\nWe found it very clean as we did the rest of this city. Very impressed with Taxco.

558435598.name: Nice zocalo
558435598.author: a TripAdvisor user
558435598.reviewBody: Decent zocalo, but super crowded with tourists. Not very impressed with this town... more of a tourist trap than anything else. Tons of people trying to get you into their shops around the zocalo. Unless you\u2019re into silver, it\u2019s not that exciting.

558177334.name: Centre of everything
558177334.author: a TripAdvisor user
558177334.reviewBody: The Zocalo is a very special part of a very special town.  It\'s great to hang out there and be part of the action.  It\'s a little bit like the centre of a fairy tale town square.\n\nJust lovely.

550316084.name: NYE
550316084.author: a TripAdvisor user
550316084.reviewBody:
A must when in Taxco. Taxi drivers are very helpful and offer great recommendations. 

Lots of shops and things to see.  The people here are very friendly and helpful, not very pushy. 

Very safe for family and small kids

548293084.name: Authentic mexican zocalo!
548293084.author: a TripAdvisor user
548293084.reviewBody: take ten minutes or more to sit at a Z\u00f3calo bench! you will feel the real mood of may mexican towns.

547443324.name: Beautiful Taxco
547443324.author: a TripAdvisor user
547443324.reviewBody: Sorrounded by mountains, cobblestone streets that take you up and down the endless hidden parts of the town, white beatles as taxis, silver markets and lovely  colours. Colours of buildings, colours of flowers hanging all around, colours of delicious food and the most beautiful colours of people that want to help you, are willing to have a conversation and tell you all the secrets of this country. Amazing Taxco! Amazing Mexico!

544107607.name: Really nice
544107607.author: a TripAdvisor user
544107607.reviewBody: The center of the city is beautiful, surrounded by restaurants, a big church, a small park with a rocky road.

539560417.name: A Beautiful City Overrun by People and Cars
539560417.author: a TripAdvisor user
539560417.reviewBody: Taxco is indeed a beautiful, hilly city with charming winding streets and lovely views over the countryside. \nSadly it has become completely overrun with people and cars that are choking the streets and you with their exhaust fumes. \nThe city lives on tourism and as a tourist you will be constantly harangued by touts offering you tours, trying to coax you into restaurants and shops and generally being very aggressive in their selling style. The days to visit this city are long past and I suggest you concentrate on other Pueblos Magicos to experience the beauty of this country and its people. Avoid.

522124507.name: Nice \'pachanga\' at night!
522124507.author: a TripAdvisor user
522124507.reviewBody: Great event that was going on when we showed up which consisted of music, food, and lots of kids. Very cool!

512920206.name: Mexican Experience
512920206.author: a TripAdvisor user
512920206.reviewBody: A relatively small but bustling center plaza.  Stay for the evening and enjoy the locals as they come to play and socialize thru the night.  Its a great way to experience all that Mexico really is!

504331144.name: Nice Plaza!!
504331144.author: a TripAdvisor user
504331144.reviewBody: I spent several days in Taxco, Mexico. The Zocalo is a very nice plaza where the tourist, families, friends meet to enjoy the evening. Very safe place. I danced at the plaza.

495702266.name: Nice
495702266.author: a TripAdvisor user
495702266.reviewBody: Many, many shops and restaurants. The week-end is  full with locals. Eating, dancing and just people watching. Be aware, everything is on a hill.

489723319.name: real nice
489723319.author: a TripAdvisor user
489723319.reviewBody: you buy an Ice Cream and sit here for a while if you can shoe shine your shoes is a great spot of town where everything passes through here. Great place to sit and observe the local people and very safe.

485988005.name: Beautiful Z\u00f3calo
485988005.author: a TripAdvisor user
485988005.reviewBody: Taxco has a really nice Z\u00f3calo with an impressive cathedral. At the Z\u00f3calo there a various other nice historic buildings and some restaurants with rooftop terraces and great views.\nOnly downside is the traffic around the Z\u00f3calo - it should be restricted.

482417468.name: Centerpoint of Mexico City
482417468.author: a TripAdvisor user
482417468.reviewBody:
The Zocalo is at the heart of Mexico City. Thge side roads leading to the Zocalo are full of shops and restaurants, the Calle 5 de Febrero is closed to vehicles and you can find a large aray of shops including brand names like Zara, Benneton etc.. Around the Zocalo you can find several places of interest, a must see is the National Palace with the phenomenal Diego Rivera murals and it is free. You can also visit ancient Aztec temple ruins . All the area is safe.

I recommend the Hotel Historico Central a few blocks from the Zocalo.

478328375.name: MAGIC ZOCOLO
478328375.author: a TripAdvisor user
478328375.reviewBody: No matter how many times  I return here it is not enough! I can picture it in  my mind when I am thousands of miles away

473698289.name: Wonderfully picturesque!
473698289.author: a TripAdvisor user
473698289.reviewBody: Maneuvering around this very dense, congested mountain town is arduous and confusing, at best but can you--follow the signage and you\'ll eventually get to the cathedral. Parking is equally difficult but totally possible, often with the help of a local who is likely endorsing a friend\'s parking lot. A hike, generally uphill, to the cathedral and the plaza is not that difficult, in spite of the folks guiding you to their favorite restaurant or silver shops. The zocalo is very clean and there\'s plenty of seating to take in the local color. By all means make the trek!

473489497.name: Beautiful Town
473489497.author: a TripAdvisor user
473489497.reviewBody: Walking through this town is a walk through old Mexico. The buildings are colonial and the streets were designed for horses not cars. This is the town of silver so stop in and\u200b perhaps you will purchase some 925 Sterling. Go to the Zocola and enjoy the sights. Visit the Cathedral next to the Zocola. It is well worth the effort.

470279839.name: Lovely hidden gem
470279839.author: a TripAdvisor user
