470279839.reviewBody: This was one of the highlights of our trip! It is by far a town that like many others preserves their culture and historical buildings. Just beautiful! Plenty to observe, eat, drink and just take in.

469679649.name: Nice and cozy square
469679649.author: a TripAdvisor user
469679649.reviewBody: Nice and cozy square for a walk or just to sit and watch the people and beetles going by. nice restaurants around it.

466367946.name: Plaza Borda
466367946.author: a TripAdvisor user
466367946.reviewBody: It is a beautiful place where you can stroll, people watch.There are restaurants and silver shops, places to buy your Taxco souvenirs and of course the Cathedral. If tired sit on the bench and try to  take it all in. Lovely heart of the city.

465955877.name: A quick trip!
465955877.author: a TripAdvisor user
465955877.reviewBody: My father like to came to this beautiful and colorful town, where the Spanish architecture is everywhere you look... the people from this city is really polite and grateful. \nYou can find unique and different dishes, from green with chicharron pozole to fresh Jumiles (comestibles insects).\nYou looking for souvenirs???... don\'t worry, you\'ll find silver 9.25 everywhere!!!

464361844.name: Heart of the City
464361844.author: a TripAdvisor user
464361844.reviewBody: This plaza or z\u00f3calo is a definite must on your visit to Taxco.  The zocalo, although small, has an energy about it that\'s worth a visit.  Enjoy sitting on a bench under the trees and people watch.  When you\'re tired, take in one of the many restaurants and enjoy a meal or drink while overlooking this heart of the city.  The only negative is you\'ll be asked a million times to enter stores selling silver or buy items from street vendors.  The zocalo is a great spot to take a cab ride up to see the Monumento Cristo  or walk across to visit the cathedral.

459053873.name: Lots to do, lots to see
459053873.author: a TripAdvisor user
459053873.reviewBody: While it is a bit small and overcrowded, the city center of Taxco is still magnificently beautiful. Full of other tourists, a beautiful church, plenty of Silver shops, restaurants, and street vendors, the hustle and bustle of Taxco is put on full display here. Both the Federal Police and the Military Police patrol the Zocalo of Taxco so feel confident and safe that you are protected during your visit.

457622363.name: City Center!
457622363.author: a TripAdvisor user
457622363.reviewBody: I visited Taxco y a long weekend holiday we had in Mexico with my wife.  Our expectations of the city were surpassed and I really recommend coming here.  \nTaxco is renowned for being a mining city and the best place to buy silver jewelry and  items.  \n The zocalo is a great place to start.  You can visit the Cathedral, Shop in the many silver markets and stores available, listen to local artists playing and eat in many restaurants with very nice views.

457480591.name: It is small plaza with a lot of restaurant and silver shops.
457480591.author: a TripAdvisor user
457480591.reviewBody: This is a very small downtown square but the church and white houses over the hills gives a lot of beauty to it. You can enjoy some ice cream or just do some window shopping.

455374590.name: An  amazing church and plaza
455374590.author: a TripAdvisor user
455374590.reviewBody: We had been admiring the architecture of the church from the outside for some time and then entered the courtyard area.  An older Mexican gentleman wearing a badge asked if we would like a tour.  He worked for the local tourist agency and did a wonderful job.  He was very knowledgeable about its history and acrhitecture.He answered our questions and gave us other tips for Taxco.  The church is truly unique and incredibly ornate.  We gave the tour guide a tip as he didn\'t require a fee.

442706353.name: Most Beautiful Church ever
442706353.author: a TripAdvisor user
442706353.reviewBody: I have visited and seen many churches.  I have travelled far and wide but never have I seen a church this beautiful and great.  The inside is beyond description.  The guide was excellent in telling us the history of the church.  I have to rate this as the most beautiful church to date.  If you are in the area, you must go visit.  Clear away from the beggars.  If you give to one, they will swarm you.  The guide is good at keeping them away.

442001144.name: Keep walking
442001144.author: a TripAdvisor user
442001144.reviewBody: You\'re going to have to pass through the Zocalo, but do your best to keep walking. If you stop you\'ll get swarmed by super-aggressive vendors. They don\'t listen to "No, gracias" - the only thing that seemed to work some of the time was "Ya tengo uno/a" (I have one already).  It was super frustrating to deal with them.

431854393.name: Great place to relax and people watch
431854393.author: a TripAdvisor user
431854393.reviewBody: Seems every time I am there the music invites people to dance. I love to just sit and watch both the dancers and those around the square.

427876814.name: Pretty
427876814.author: a TripAdvisor user
427876814.reviewBody: A great little square full of local character. The square is surrounded by silver shops who are not overly pushy. The square has seats with trees to watch time pass by.

425728399.name: Silver Shopping!
425728399.author: a TripAdvisor user
425728399.reviewBody: Great shopping for silver and jewellery offer cash and they will give you a good discount. Lovely to just wander the streets too!

420491352.name: Functioning church, and more beetle cars in one place!
420491352.author: a TripAdvisor user
420491352.reviewBody: Church was in session so we couldn\'t explore. On the outside, it\'s a nice pink overlooking a square (as per most towns in Mexico). Taxis are all white beetle cars, which makes the town a little cute in a way. Silver shops everywhere

416403409.name: Always exciting...
416403409.author: a TripAdvisor user
416403409.reviewBody: Small but really exciting place to hang around. There are musicians, street vendors, people, and many restaurants around the zocalo. best place in taxco

397704216.name: Great!
397704216.author: a TripAdvisor user
397704216.reviewBody: Loved wandering around Taxco\'s zocalo.  Very small but very quaint.  Just what I had in mind when I thought what a Central Mexico village would be like!

384992542.name: Culture
384992542.author: a TripAdvisor user
384992542.reviewBody: This is a great town to visit. Everything is within walking distances. Taxis are available everywhere. Full of history and culture.

380019878.name: Charming park in front of Santa Prisca
380019878.author: a TripAdvisor user
380019878.reviewBody: You get to know the town by seating at the main plaza an looking at   local people and watching how they interact with each other.  It is remarkable that we did not see people smoking.

366432506.name: The whole town meets here!
366432506.author: a TripAdvisor user
366432506.reviewBody: We were lucky to be in town for the 5km local run.\nYou needed to be a mountain goat to run this one.\nLive band with a 100+ people dancing at 9pm was a real highlight!!

365172769.name: Great zocalo, very beautiful the only down side is people hassling you.
365172769.author: a TripAdvisor user
365172769.reviewBody: Great terrace views from some restaurants. The zocalo is always full with people every where in Mexico which i love, I just found this zocalo to be a little annoying with the constant hassle from people. But it is a wonderful place with great architecture and woinderful views.

361053844.name: Too much traffic and too many touts
361053844.author: a TripAdvisor user
361053844.reviewBody: Ok. It\'s lovely and fun. Sometimes music. Plenty of people watching. But way too much traffic and too many people trying to get us to buy jewelry or other stuff, or eat in various restaurants. Leave us alone please!

357815411.name: Beautiful!
357815411.author: a TripAdvisor user
357815411.reviewBody: Very nice and beautiful place, full of life. You can sit and watch people around and also take a lot of pictures, as you get a very nice view from there. There are several shops, coffees and restaurants around, you can spend a couple of hours there and enjoy it.

349511776.name: Very Small, Surprisingly Good
349511776.author: a TripAdvisor user
349511776.reviewBody: The zocalo in Taxco is a small brick square with a few trees and a gazebo.  A surprising amount of activity takes place in this mini-zocalo and it certainly has a good view of the baroque church.  At night, children race around and the trees are decorated with illuminated stars.  All in all, it is a very pleasant place to sit for half an hour and watch the world pass by.

349017244.name: Best town square in Mexico
349017244.author: a TripAdvisor user
349017244.reviewBody: Something happening day and night here.  Loved people watching here. Shops mostly jewellery, but cheaper off the square.  Plenty of restaurants.Beautifully trimmed trees complete with many Mexican star heaped lanterns.

344585685.name: romantic, beautiful place
344585685.author: a TripAdvisor user
344585685.reviewBody: muy bonito. I went there with my friend, but someday I want to go again with boyfriend. it is so romantic.

344402774.name: Good place to hangout
344402774.author: a TripAdvisor user
344402774.reviewBody: Good place to hangout and enjoy the city at night. You may find some good restaurants which offer roof top and balcony and from there you can enjoy the view of the city and mountains at night

336460966.name: Shopping shopping and more shopping!
336460966.author: a TripAdvisor user
336460966.reviewBody: Great fun visiting Taxco.  Shopkeepers and street persons eager to sell to you but no one seemed pushy.  Very accepting of all responses to their marketing techniques.  A pleasure to visit!

323677437.name: The night life of Taxco
323677437.author: a TripAdvisor user
323677437.reviewBody: By its very nature, the Zocalo is the heart of Taxco, it is where everybody comes to just hang out in the evening, or meet up during the day, and then branch out into the town from there. My girlfriend tells stories of walking around the Zocalo with friends during her childhood, it was apparently the thing to do, and frankly it still seems to be. It\'s fun to just go and sit and hang out, watch the people wander by, catch up and talk with friends, grab some typical food, snacks, drinks, etc., and just lose track of time. Do a little window shopping at the overpriced silver stores (hit the local silver open market on Saturday, buy direct, much better prices) grab a coffee and maybe some ice cream... enjoy the feeling that comes with slowing down, and stepping back in time.

319615192.name: "Everything you can imagine"
319615192.author: a TripAdvisor user
319615192.reviewBody: Taxco`s central park (zocalo) is a magnificent place to visit. Compared to other zocalos, Taxco`s is small but one of my preferred ones due to the fact you can find almost everything you can imagine in this small piece of land: crafts (wood, clay, ceramic, fabrics, etc), food on-the-go (botanas), ice cream, jewelry, plants, toys, flowers, furniture, etc.!!! Close by you will find the local market (tiangis) where you can find even further delights like all sort of vegetables, fresh meat, cheese, milk jam, nuts and much more. Culture, colors, flavors, sounds: all combined in the wonderful Taxco`s zocalo!

306771809.name: Good place to people watch, dine, eat and buy from street vendors
306771809.author: a TripAdvisor user
306771809.reviewBody: Of course you can\'t miss the Zocolo.  It is the center of town.  There are lots of street vendors of both food and clothing,  hats and baskets woven of Palm are everywhere

306502855.name: Pass through or sit a while
306502855.author: a TripAdvisor user
306502855.reviewBody: Quite small compared for example to mexico city, But these zocalo are great in terms of getting a feel for the life of the town or city you are visiting. from old men sitting in the sun, to makeshift street stalls through to kids playing

288585764.name: go there!!
288585764.author: a TripAdvisor user
288585764.reviewBody: Wow, the history and beauty of this place!!  Zocalos were and are so important to their culture.  This one is a favorite.

281162315.name: The best of many lively plazas in Taxco
281162315.author: a TripAdvisor user
281162315.reviewBody: Plaza Borda (Zocalo) is a great stroll. There are also several more plazas and capillas (churches dedicated to a certain saint or lady) to visit too. They\'re mostly located in the historical center and make for a great evening stroll. I recommend starting at Chavarrieta, than continue towards Plaza Borda along Calle Juarez until you end up at Plaza San Juan. From here head south down Calle Hidalgo, continue and turn on Calle Morelos until you reach the main road. On this route you will see about 6 different churches and a few plazas. The plazas are nice because they\'re a little smaller and more intimate than Plaza Borda. Like Plaza Borda you will most likely run into great street food in the plazas. There are guided walking tours that begin at the Exconvento of Taxco they\'re on Friday nights. To see more recommendations and reviews on Taxco: http://cocinax.com/travel/taxco-guerrero

278766345.name: Town Center
278766345.author: a TripAdvisor user
278766345.reviewBody: Great meeting place to see the local color. Restaurants, Santa Prisca church, artisans...and tour guides. The silver stores tend to be very pricy on the zocalo. Fun to discover all streets that join the zocalo: up for the views; down either side of the church for artisan stands; laterally for more jewelry shops lining the Main Street.  Enjoy the restaurants and the great views from the rooftops onto the zocalo below. Visit Rocio and Paisa in the little shop down the hill toward the Centro Joyero on the right. Rocio is a wealth of knowledge on Mexican Artisans and the villages they come from. Her store is just a small representation of them.

277410824.name: Calm, gorgeous
277410824.author: a TripAdvisor user
277410824.reviewBody: Even during a political rally the atmosphere was perfect. Never had an issue during any of our 4 trips to Taxco in the zocolo.

273119492.name: Heart of the city
273119492.author: a TripAdvisor user
273119492.reviewBody: The zocalo is the central place of the city, like the other zocalos of the country. The Taxco\'s zocalo is very pleasant. It is surrounded by the Parroquia Santa Prisca (a must-see), the Casa Cultura (Jos\u00e9 de Borda\'s house), silver shops, restaurants, etc.

272194102.name: I love to just walk around
272194102.author: a TripAdvisor user
272194102.reviewBody: If you\u00b4re the kind that likes to just wander... then taxco is the destination for you!... and it\u00b4s Zocalo is the best place to go do it

270926409.name: Great palce!
270926409.author: a TripAdvisor user
270926409.reviewBody: Great place for picture taking and good silver,   charming,  colonial little town,  the bust station is close to the zocalo where there is a nice church.

268733972.name: Best place in mexico
268733972.author: a TripAdvisor user
268733972.reviewBody: Taxco is a gem, truly a jewell hidden between mountains, and really close to DF! Silver, churches, traditional structures and buildings, it\'s amazing and the most beautiful Z\u00f3calo I\'ve been to!

263331455.name: Beautiful church, watch out for the taxis!
263331455.author: a TripAdvisor user
263331455.reviewBody: I love Taxco, and it is generally safe to walk around the streets, but you\'ve really got to watch out for the Taxi\'s because they\'re like land sharks, whipping in and out between pedestrians who are forced to walk along on very narrow streets, with two-way traffic in most places, I can\'t imagine what it must be like to actually drive here, but the taxi\'s are way to aggressive, it\'s very nice to walk around when they close the streets at night for the processions. The church is beautiful, especially at night when it is illuminated, be sure to wander down to the mercado and partake in some of the wonderful food that is offered there, it is much better tasting than anything I found in the restaurants around the Zocalo, and significantly less expensive, you just don\'t get the views...

261636160.name: Great place, specialy one guy
261636160.author: a TripAdvisor user
261636160.reviewBody:
This place is great!
Unfortunately there are a lot of this unpleasant people that want to sell you something or "help" you by sending you to their shops. They are like organised in gangs. Sit in a cofee around the square and watch the scenery, you will understand.

BUT, there is one guy, a taller one with glasses that cleans up the place by night and day. And he is doing a great job.
So I spend him 50 peso, because it is like he is the only local that is doing hard work and he is worth it.

258489886.name: Street food was great
258489886.author: a TripAdvisor user
258489886.reviewBody: We ate at one of the fancy terraces with a view but the food we enjoyed the most was on the street, sitting on the benches and watching the people.

258259181.name: Perfect place to hang around for a while in Taxco
258259181.author: a TripAdvisor user
258259181.reviewBody: Sorrounded by the hillsides, street vendors, musicians, the silver market, the cathedral and plenty restaurants. A nice small zocalo to soak up the atmosphere of Taxco.

256064857.name: great view of the cathedral
256064857.author: a TripAdvisor user
256064857.reviewBody: Great view of the best attraction in the city. Spent half an hour just admiring the center of this colonial gem

255902032.name: Silver=Taxco in Mexico
255902032.author: a TripAdvisor user
255902032.reviewBody: Half way between Acapulco and Mexico City DF is Taxco, the sterling silver capital of Mexico. The town is were shop owners from all over the world go to to buy exquisite sterling silver jewelry for their own stores (including us!). Although many of the suppliers are wholesale only, there are also so many retail shops, it\'s hard to decide where to go first. There is also the silver market every Saturday, where you can purchase last years styles fro a fraction of the US price -- but bargain, bargain, bargain!  And, wear comfy shoes! The streets are either up hill or down hill. A good backpack will be a good idea too to carry all of your treasures in! Unless you\'re a serious silver buyer, all you really need is a day trip. Most shops do expect you to buy with pesos now; there is a limit on the amount of US dollars that can be accepted. Do take pesos with you tho, it\'s difficult to change US to pesos anywhere except the bank, and the lines are usually pretty long. But, do check out the churches -- they are breathtaking. The food is great everywhere (even street food) but, DON\'T DRINK THE WATER OR DRINK BEVERAGES WITH ICE IN THEM! If you go get sick though, any pharmacy can get you supplied with meds that will help. The vendors in the Zocolo do expect serious barganing, so be prepared. Also, be prepared for children either begging or trying to sell you Chicklets gum. If you\'re going to take photos of the residents, please be polite and ask first.

250402543.name: Fun Fun with Ice cold beer....
250402543.author: a TripAdvisor user
250402543.reviewBody: Lots of vendors.. very colorful. prices are very good. Lots of great resturantants around the Zocalo. Plenty of music and lots of fun and get your camers ready..

247572225.name: Beautiful place with a lot of magic!
247572225.author: a TripAdvisor user
247572225.reviewBody: I love Taxco i think is one of the most beautiful towns in Mexico and every time i visit it i go down to the zocalo every single day! Is the place where all happens, you see the people going to the church and waking up to open their stores in the morning, in the mid day you can visit all the silver stores and the handcraft pottery stands behind the church, you\u00b4ll find beautiful handcraft silver jewelry and at very good prices but remember always to dribble! they are always ready to low the price! I always go crazy there and want to buy everything!!! In the evening they have music and dance, i like to walk a little near the church and find a place to buy an "elote" that is a boiled corn in cob and they prepare it for you with mayonnaise, cheese and chili powder! or you can go to one of the many bars and restaurants to have a drink and chill out a little with a magnificent view of the church at night! This time we went in December so we could enjoy the beautiful chistmas decorations.\nYou\'ll love this picturesque, full of life and beautiful place!!!\nA good advise is to take comfortable shoes because all the streets in Taxco are of cobbled stone so a flat shoe is a must!!!

244167809.name: LOTS OF INTERESTING ACTIVITIES
244167809.author: a TripAdvisor user
244167809.reviewBody: Lots going on here with bars, restaurants, shops (especially silver shops). Great for dining, drinking, shopping, or just people-watching.

238398227.name: The hang out.
238398227.author: a TripAdvisor user
238398227.reviewBody: The Zocalo is the place to see people and be seen by people. Each night we found ourselves at this center of town for different periods of time. There was music and dancing by all the locals and some of the more fun outgoing tourists. The beautiful church is right there along with silver shops, coffee bars, restaurants and a whole bunch of stuff to see. When in most towns of Mexico you need to chill at the Zocalo!

237914361.name: Picturesque square
237914361.author: a TripAdvisor user
237914361.reviewBody: We were in Taxco for the Dia de los Muertos weekend.  The Zocalo is very pretty and colourful with nice roof top restaurants and bars which were great for people watching.  The atmosphere for Dia de los Muertos was lots of fun and everyone makes an effort to dress up and take part in the evening parades.  There are lots of silversmith shops in the zocalo, however, we found it a bit annoying that you couldn\'t walk 5 steps without a shop employee trying to get you through their doors when all we wanted to do was explore the town under our own steam. The rose coloured stone of the Prisca Cathedral is beautiful at sun set and it\'s worth a visit inside.

231579442.name: A vibrant and colourful place to see!
231579442.author: a TripAdvisor user
231579442.reviewBody: I went to Taxco in spring 2013. The zocalo is basically the area where people of all ages hang out in Taxco. There you will find shops, restaurants, the Santa Prisca church and much more. The atmosphere is so charming! You can sit down, relax and meet people.The Zocalo is also the place to be when there are events going on. It\'s a very nice place to see!

227816665.name: Magical place!
227816665.author: a TripAdvisor user
227816665.reviewBody: The Zocalo at Taxco is lively and colorful, and the Santa Prisca Cathedral really crowns it. Taxco should definitely be visited!

207478125.name: Nice small Zocalo
207478125.author: a TripAdvisor user
207478125.reviewBody: This small Zocalo is the meeting point of the tourists and the local inhabitants.Just sit down and enjoy life and this unique moment. Listen to the life !

203097870.name: Great walking area and town
203097870.author: a TripAdvisor user
203097870.reviewBody:
Great place to go for viewing an incredible and unusual church. although it needs a good dusting  with all its intricate carvings.
A good place to shop for silver but be VERY careful of the quality
There are many many shops but only a very few have original items.
The narrow streets feel very European and nice food available everywhere.
We loved the street popcorn !!!

202565365.name: Place where everything happens.
202565365.author: a TripAdvisor user
202565365.reviewBody: Cute, little, lively main square with trees and benches right in front of Santa Prisca church. Be there, especially in the evening, when they play music.

198113866.name: Small town charm
198113866.author: a TripAdvisor user
198113866.reviewBody: The Zocalo is the "center" part of Taxco.  There\'s frequently a live mariachi band and tons of folks and families roaming around.  It\'s a great people watching spto!

197183565.name: Great site to climb to one of balconies of the reatarants in front of the plaza and have a panoramic view of the town
197183565.author: a TripAdvisor user
197183565.reviewBody: Excellent location from one of the restaurant to take a panoramic view of the city.  Just be careful to the car traffic around the main square at certain times of the day.

196009028.name: Zocalo shopping for silver
196009028.author: a TripAdvisor user
196009028.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the silver shop called HECHO A MANO. He has two shops, one is located right in the Zocalo (left of the church where the little interior cafe is located). He is a designer of very unique, beautiful jewelry. His pieces may be a bit higher, but you will not find them anywhere else. He is a very honest man and wants to share his enthusiasm for the art of silver making. Don\'t miss it!

195133873.name: Buzz of activity
195133873.author: a TripAdvisor user
195133873.reviewBody: This is the place to feel the pulse of Taxco. This square anchors the city, and holds the cathedral. It has an undeniable touristy feel to it, yet it is great for soaking in the sights and sounds of Taxco.

190972434.name: Busy central place in Merida
190972434.author: a TripAdvisor user
190972434.reviewBody: There is always something going on but there are also a lot of people trying to trick tourists. Go there, look but don\'t buy, smell but don\'t eat there, listen but don\'t do what they tell you. The tourist office there is completely useless - they can only hand out a map, nothing else. Still it\'s nice to watch. Mind your personal belongings.

190090514.name: THE hang out spot
190090514.author: a TripAdvisor user
190090514.reviewBody: loved the Zocalo for, of course, the splendid Cathedral and the ordinary life of people hanging out and selling their wares and the shops surrounding and leading off the square. Particularly impressive is the silver, and the customer service 8friendly, patient, English speaking staff) in Elena Ballesteros\u00b4 shop just to the West corner of the Cathedral\'s facade. So, the Zocalo is the beating heart of Taxco and an unmissable sight.

189373420.name: colorful taxco
189373420.author: a TripAdvisor user
189373420.reviewBody: we visited TAXCO (by taxi from cuernavaco)  at a NON-market time... it was busy, fun, laid-back, friendly! we ate grasshoppers in the market, drank pulque on the street, marched up the steep path to the ruin and wandered the village!  (by choice, NO shopping or massages...)  it was a place we would return - and stay longer! on the same day trip, we stopped at the wonderful olmec ruin and museo at XOCHICALCO.

189162494.name: Mariachis and Shoe Shiners
189162494.author: a TripAdvisor user
189162494.reviewBody: A nice, but small main plaza, Taxco\'s zocalo is usually packed on the weekends with visitors, locals, mariachi bands and shoe shine boys.  The ubiquitous white volkswagon taxis are constantly going around and there are some fine restaurants and jewelry shops all around.  A nice place to hang out and people watch.

184982083.name: Beautiful
184982083.author: a TripAdvisor user
184982083.reviewBody: Ignore the touristy things, and just soak in the little square and the life happening there and around it. Ask where you can take a little bus/van all the way up the hill, to where you can see a statue of Christ (which is vaguely like the one in Rio). From up there, you can gaze down upon the red roofs of the beautiful sprawl that is Taxco. Worth seeing if the sight of these kinds of towns isn\'t something you\'re used to.

184359943.name: Fun Fun fun
184359943.author: a TripAdvisor user
184359943.reviewBody: This is another place you need to see and if you are going to visit the Sanat Prisca you cant miss it anyway...this is the way life should be cafes. shopping people visiting and children playing in the park surrounded by beauty in ever direction

179236746.name: Not worth it
179236746.author: a TripAdvisor user
179236746.reviewBody: Took a day trip from Mexico City. The 3 hour drive would have been worth it if Taxco was as beautiful as they say it is . It is so commercial and all the silver shops look the same. Prices of silver are better off in the US.... It is not what it\'s hyped up to be. Moreover it is dirty and the town is not well maintained. Careful not to take the wrong turn into their main market which is packed and hard to get out. There is also the teleferico which is ok but not exactly the most exiting thing.\nBetter to check out another place to visit in Mexico

178068175.name: Good Chill
178068175.author: a TripAdvisor user
178068175.reviewBody: Watch the world go by, as you cool your heels for a bit after climbing, descending, haggling and scoring some world class art and silver. Maybe bite on a heavenly churro (without sugar) if its permitted.

177392067.name: Terrific Tasco
177392067.author: a TripAdvisor user
177392067.reviewBody: A great destination not far from Mexico City, Taxco is such a great little town with winding cobble-stoned streets and an eye-catching Guadi-esque cathedral at the Zocalo. Nearby is a stunning and little-visited waterfall called...La Cascada (how original). It rivals Basaseachi--Mexico\'s highest permanent waterfall--in height. Also nearby are the magnificent Grutas de Cacahuamilpa with fantastical cave formations throughout.  You can\'t go wrong with Tasco.

171987125.name: Beautiful
171987125.author: a TripAdvisor user
171987125.reviewBody: Great town center.  Very cute and picturesque.  A must do in Taxco.  Venture further from the zocalo if you buy silver to save some money.  Saturday they have the market in the Avenida Principal and the prices are great.  Wish I had bought more.

171511990.name: Beautiful City!  Great silver shops and beautiful buildings and streets!
171511990.author: a TripAdvisor user
171511990.reviewBody: Beautiful city.  White washed buildings with red clay roofs set into the mountain.  Reminded me of a small Greek town the way the buildings are built into the hill.  Friendly, definitely touristy, but manageable and primarily Mexican tourists.  The Zocalo (center) has musicians and people selling baskets and pottery.  The gorgeous cathedral is worth visiting as well. See the cathedral with a guide if you can (in Spanish though).  About 1 1/2 hours from Tepotzolan/Cuernavaca with gorgeous views the last part of the trip..  Sip a coffee on the terrace of one of the upscale restaurants around the center and explore the silver shops which were fine. Loved that they sold Mexican tiles too. A great trip town to visit!

167985416.name: Gives new meaning to ROCOCO
167985416.author: a TripAdvisor user
167985416.reviewBody: A magnificent exterior, and the most ornate interior of any of the hundreds of churches I\'ve visited over the years. Completely over the top. Photos couldn\'t do it justice. If you\'re anywhere near this incredibly picturesque town, with its winding tiled/cobblestone narrow streets climbing he steep hills, be sure to check it out. Just ignore the dozens of vendors and guides trying to get you to deal with them.

167574151.name: Relaxing in the heart of a minero pueblo que tiene magia
167574151.author: a TripAdvisor user
167574151.reviewBody: The church and the z\u00f3calo are corresponding. To Your heart. Believe it or not, preaching or talking, playing or shopping. Be Yourself in the shadow of the trees, before You buy some silver or just mexican food: enchilada verde, chilaquiles, arrachera ...

164847240.name: So vibrant
164847240.author: a TripAdvisor user
164847240.reviewBody: Like most of the squares in Latin America, this one is vibrant and a place of real abiding for locals and tourists alike. You can spend an entire Saturday here milling around, visiting the shops and then relaxing with shaved ice, or an ice- cream cone, listening to a random group of Mariachi practicing and laughing. Worth the visit, not just for what it is, but also for the fact that it is truly the centre of everything here in Tazco. If you get lost wondering the narrow streets, feasting your eyes on craft and indulging in pastel de elote,  just look up and keep an eye on the towering Cathedral above to find your way back.

163171127.name: Amazing
163171127.author: a TripAdvisor user
163171127.reviewBody: The Zocalo is a great place to hang and watch the world go by (and the VW taxis).  Good views of the cathedral and constant entertainment watching the characters and musicians.

163090178.name: Great place to rest and get the taste of town
163090178.author: a TripAdvisor user
163090178.reviewBody: Beautiful plaza to sit and watch people pass by as you taste some of the local delicacies and snacks. On weekends there is music. The tourism booth is very useful and efficient.

159395558.name: small nice park next to beautiful cathedral
159395558.author: a TripAdvisor user
159395558.reviewBody: always popular in the center of each Mexican town...nice park and located across from the beautiful cathedral...great to sit, relax and people watch

153770291.name: Love it!
153770291.author: a TripAdvisor user
153770291.reviewBody: I wander around this area often, it\'s full of history, nice people, good places to sit and have coffee, artisans around the zocalo....etc.  It\'s a great environment and I always look forward to going back.

150504129.name: Life at its best!
150504129.author: a TripAdvisor user
150504129.reviewBody: Bustling, beautiful Zocolo! Right at the Cathedral and surrounded by restaurants and silver shops.  Take a guide in the Cathedral, we\'ll worth it!

148890143.name: A labirynth of stalls
148890143.author: a TripAdvisor user
148890143.reviewBody: A great market built on several levels and full of hallways, corridors, stairs and narrow pasages.  Not the place for claustaphobics!  Worth a half day to explore and enjoy.

137223117.name: A beautiful place to spend an evening.
137223117.author: a TripAdvisor user
137223117.reviewBody: The zocalo is the heart of the city.  It is a great place to spend an evening and watch the families spend their evenings.  Sometimes on the weekend the shut the place down to all but foot traffic.

135028829.name: not to clean
135028829.author: a TripAdvisor user
135028829.reviewBody: man i eat green tamale made from bannana leaf and almost shocked on the bones

131621175.name: Great plaza, lots of hustlers, but fun people watching
131621175.author: a TripAdvisor user
131621175.reviewBody: Whatever you decide to by its worth half the asking price

128950593.name: Quaint square
128950593.author: a TripAdvisor user
128950593.reviewBody: Very local flavor with many locals enjoying the square

128451602.name: Mexico at it\'s finest
128451602.author: a TripAdvisor user
128451602.reviewBody: I love to sit at the zocolo and watch the world of Mexico unfold.  Kids playing chase, teenagers holding hands, women gossiping and old folks enjoying the show.

126674405.name: Pretty Town Square
126674405.author: a TripAdvisor user
126674405.reviewBody: Great place to rest in the shade of the trees market stalls selling everthing, almost all of the major Silver Retailers are on the edge of the Zocalo and it\'s only a short walk down the street to the bank or the silver market. The town market can be accessed from near the Cathedral but be careful it\'s a real rabbit warren don\'t get lost.

125949583.name: LOVE TAXCO
125949583.author: a TripAdvisor user
125949583.reviewBody:
Taxco is a real treat. It's laid in beautiful mountains which gives amazing views wherever you are in the city. The streets are extremely steep and beautiful with black shiny cobblestone and white decorations. The houses are all painted in the same colors: dark red and white with red tile roofs. It is such a pleasure just walking the streets but make sure you get of the touristiest areas as well. We were there during the Dia de Muertos and it was amazing. There were beautiful flower decorations everywhere and so much bustling activity from locals preparing for the festivities. We loved just sitting on street corners watching the locals. In the evening of the Dia de Muertos there was a parade on the central Plaza Borda (Zocalo) and a very happy and easy atmosphere. In the morning of Dia de Muertos we went to the Taxco cemetery Pantheon to see all the locals bring flowers and decoration for their family graves, clean them, have picnic there and enjoy the day remembering their passed away family member. The non-stop line of white beetle taxis going to the crowded area in front of the cemetery was a sight in itself. The cemetery is worth the visit any day. It's one big maze of graves without any structure at all. You literally have to climb over and walk on the graves to move around in there. 

The Santa Prisca cathedral on Plaza Borda is amazing and reflects the enormous wealth from the silver mines around Taxco. The restaurants on Plaza Borda are rather touristy and a bit overprized. We went to smaller places away from the center with cheap and good roasted chicken: "Pollo asado".

We liked the Indian Market next to the cathedral even more. You get lost in there and can spend hours looking at the many cramped-in stalls with colorful products. We went there several times during our 3-days stay in the city. 

The Christ monument overlooking the city is also well worth the visit. It's a steep ride up there and the view is breathtaking. You can basically see everything in the city. 

One of the most fascinating things about Taxco is the 200 white beetle taxis that climb the steep streets of the city. They must be geared differently to ride those streets. It's really amazing and I think we took 100 pictures of the Taxco taxis alone!

We didn't visit any silver stores and felt that part of Taxco was a bit too touristy for us. 

We walked the small streets at night and always felt safe. 

Taxco is one of the special "Pueblos Magicos" in Mexico and it deserves it. It's spectacular, surprising, heart-warm and safe. We hardly saw any western tourists there, but it seemed to be a popular place for the Mexicans to spend Dia de Muertos.

We normally stay far away from very touristy places, but we loooooove Taxco

124359718.name: A place to find good restaurants.
124359718.author: a TripAdvisor user
124359718.reviewBody: This is a stop you must make when traveling though Taxco. The best restaurants are located around it. Lots of coffee shops, ice cream places and silver stores.

123987095.name: Definitely go here!
123987095.author: a TripAdvisor user
123987095.reviewBody: Town\'s center, plenty of restaurants and shopping, a must see!

123312870.name: busy with tourists and families
123312870.author: a TripAdvisor user
123312870.reviewBody: The bustling zocalo is a great place to sit and watch people. But it is a bit more quiet in the evenings after many tourists have gone. Lots of benches to sit and relax

122475339.name: Great markets, food stands, churches, etc.
122475339.author: a TripAdvisor user
122475339.reviewBody: The center of Mexico City and a must visit.  Bustling area with lots of food and street vendors, shops, etc.

14146985.name: Nice, but not that nice
14146985.author: a TripAdvisor user
14146985.reviewBody:
I've found Plaza Borda, often referred to as "the Zocalo" in Taxco, to be nice, but much less nice than so many other such plazas scattered throughout Mexico and certainly a disappointment when one considers the central role tourism plays in the city.  

The plaza is dominated by a small kiosk which is surrounded by a paved square bordered by park benches.  The center of Taxco is smothered with vehicular traffic Friday, Saturday and Sunday and on major holidays (and during vacation periods) which situation makes it a bit difficult to get to/from the plaza.

Go, enjoy yourself - but don't expect too much, and you won't be disappointed.

649237019.name: amazing
649237019.author: a TripAdvisor user
649237019.reviewBody: just beautiful gives a real glimpse of Mexican colonial life and life during the various wars. lovely go!!!

itemReviewed.name: Museo Casa de Las Lagrimas o Casa Figueroa

address.streetAddress: Entre Calle Palma y Calle 1a de Guadalupe

602499730.name: So much intriguing food for thought
602499730.author: a TripAdvisor user
602499730.reviewBody:
I somehow managed to avoid setting foot in a single silver shop during my stay in Taxco - this attraction is much more to my liking. Arrived right as it was opening and got a great tour in English by a sweet matron. It was amusing to hear her describing some of the ghastlier chapters in the house's history.

I was also really intrigued by its incarnation after it was purchased by Señor Figueroa - lots of signed photos of American celebs - Bette Davis, Elvis, a youngish Richard Nixon (!) who passed through on their way to Acapulco back in the day. I would like to know more about this man who preserved the house while decking it out with art and a tiled bar from whence he served visitors a complimentary glass of tequila after he turned it into a museum. (Alas the tradition did not survive him)

I really like this kind of museum, where the former occupants books of detective stories and the like are shelved alongside more rarified volumes. I could almost imagine that that nifty triptych medicine cabinet contained  60s era powders and pills!

itemReviewed.name: Museo Casa de Las Lagrimas o Casa Figueroa

address.streetAddress: Entre Calle Palma y Calle 1a de Guadalupe

356861603.name: Museo Casa Figueroa
356861603.author: a TripAdvisor user
356861603.reviewBody: This is exactly the type of museum that I love to stumble upon while traveling.  Very interesting, quaint, and looked over by caring docents.  Mine spoke English, accompanied me on the tour, and was a joy to be with. If for no other reason your $30 Pesos entry fee is supporting a worthwhile local treasure.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Casa de Las Lagrimas o Casa Figueroa

address.streetAddress: Entre Calle Palma y Calle 1a de Guadalupe

318973633.name: You have to see the TUNNELS used to scape! Creepy!
318973633.author: a TripAdvisor user
318973633.reviewBody: You have to see the TUNNELS used to scape! Creepy but really interesting, tons of stories took place at this old mansion, you have to listen to the stories, the BEST museum in Taxco.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Casa de Las Lagrimas o Casa Figueroa

address.streetAddress: Entre Calle Palma y Calle 1a de Guadalupe

291416572.name: Facsinating
291416572.author: a TripAdvisor user
291416572.reviewBody: For only 30 pesos, this is not to be missed. They have tours in English. The history and artifacts are so unique. Tour lasts about 30 minutes.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Casa de Las Lagrimas o Casa Figueroa

address.streetAddress: Entre Calle Palma y Calle 1a de Guadalupe

240151123.name: Interesting
240151123.author: a TripAdvisor user
240151123.reviewBody: The "House of Tears", this is a recently re-opened home with a lot of history.  I visited alone and got a private tour in English, for my 30 peso entry fee, a bargain.  Watch for secret tunnels, hiding places, and ghosts.  Just a block up the hill from the Plaza Borda.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Casa de Las Lagrimas o Casa Figueroa

address.streetAddress: Entre Calle Palma y Calle 1a de Guadalupe

663825440.name: Taxco is fabulous.
663825440.author: a TripAdvisor user
663825440.reviewBody: I went to Taxco a few years ago and love all in this city.Is small and very,very beautiful.Love all in the city.

563370269.name: J Delong
563370269.author: a TripAdvisor user
563370269.reviewBody: Have not been on our last trip as there was no a special exhibition and we had visited before. It is an interesting old home done in period antiques. If there is a special show than the tour is more engaging.

562568667.name: An amazing look at the history of Taxco y Mexcio by an excellent tour guide
562568667.author: a TripAdvisor user
562568667.reviewBody: We stumbled across this museum and were so happy we did! The person who conducted our small tour group was incredibly well versed and obviously loved his job. Many interesting artifacts are to be seen in this relatively compact museum. Others in our tour group seem equally fascinated by the tour. While there, I ran into some of my former students from Estado de Mexico, which was an added bonus. A must-see when visiting the delightful city of Taxco.

500472356.name: Can be safely missed
500472356.author: a TripAdvisor user
500472356.reviewBody: Not much in the way of museums in this silver town. Humboldt didn\'t stay here - just a few documents relating to him. Tours in Spanish only. May be temporary exhibit in lower level.

485989631.name: Nice historic mansion with a small museum
485989631.author: a TripAdvisor user
485989631.reviewBody: It is a small museum dedicated to Alexander von Humboldt who stayed here for a night. But there is nothing about him. The museum shows church portals and paintings. \nThere are is a terrace with a nice view.\nIf you pass by Casa Humboldt I would enter to see the mansion.

457484139.name: 200 year old house
457484139.author: a TripAdvisor user
457484139.reviewBody:
It is a small house close to santa prica church. The locals said that Alexander Von Humboldt stay 3 days there while going to Mexico City. 

The museum has 8 rooms. Inside each room there are pieces of all church portals and painting. It has a small terraza with a nice view. 

It is a nice place but if you skipped nothing happens.

361347497.name: Worth a short visit
361347497.author: a TripAdvisor user
361347497.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for something to do besides buying jewelry this small museum is worth a visit. Old dusty building. Humboldt slept here one night - so what. Nothing about him here. Lovely view from balcony. Interesting temporary exhibition in lower level. \n\n90+ year old tour guide was a sweetie- has given tours for 23 years.

356865494.name: Casa Humboldt Museum
356865494.author: a TripAdvisor user
356865494.reviewBody: A small, quaint museum with numerous pictures and artifacts of local importance.  The docent who accompanied me only spoke Spanish (I only speak English), but what a lovely Se\u00f1ora proud of what was on display.  I am happy to pay a $20 Pesos entry fee to keep places like this in operation.

349520107.name: Casa Humboldt  A tiny look into the past
349520107.author: a TripAdvisor user
349520107.reviewBody: Casa Humboldt or the Museum of the Vice Regal Period, is a small mansion that apparently belonged to Borda\'s son.  As one enters, they are provided a timeline of Humboldt\'s life.  The great German natural scientist spent one night in this house in the process of touring America.  Aside from the Humboldt memorabilia, we were showed a few relics of the Spanish colonization of Taxco.  Our tour was enhanced by an ancient Senora who provided descriptions in Spanish.   The artifacts were only mildly interesting but our guide, who was probably as old as they were, really brought them to life.

258587953.name: Wonderful old colonial house.
258587953.author: a TripAdvisor user
258587953.reviewBody: Being from Humboldt County, California, and having worked at Humboldt State University, I am always interested in everything "Humboldt." This is a lovely old colonial home, filled with church and period items.  Worth a visit.

182010498.name: Great museum with very good local guide
182010498.author: a TripAdvisor user
182010498.reviewBody: it is a small museum but has excellent pieces of art but the best of all are the explanations of the guides. I got a older gentleman who would tell you a lot of history about the house and taxco. don\'t miss it.

167574446.name: Sr. Humboldt de Berlin Alemania en Taxco, la ciudad magica de mineros, Mexico
167574446.author: a TripAdvisor user
167574446.reviewBody: The shadowing museum is an approach to history, with the Mexican people confronted by Spanish "education" meaning colonization for the sake of the Spanish crown. Pictures, imagination, not too much for the hurrying visitor who is escaping the hot Mexican sun of the late morning.

156164141.name: a nice surprise
156164141.author: a TripAdvisor user
156164141.reviewBody: beautiful colonial home with a great exhibit of church and personal items from the period.  A great surprise to see the plaque noting that my good and missed friend Alexander Von Wuttenau restored the building after an earthquake

645555093.name: Fun and free
645555093.author: a TripAdvisor user
645555093.reviewBody: We enjoyed going through here. Fun and free are two words that come to mind. It doesn\'t take very long, and it is cool on a hot day.

614148314.name: Under Renovation(Sep 2018)
614148314.author: a TripAdvisor user
614148314.reviewBody: This place is right in the Centro. When i entered, i just saw a silver store and a restaurant around. When i asked them about the museum, they mentioned that it is under renovation. However, they asked us to have a look around the silver jewelry that they had. It was quiet expensive and i left with my heart broken

469754788.name: Interesting but touristic
469754788.author: a TripAdvisor user
469754788.reviewBody: You go down in the silvermine. The tour was including a guide and was interesting to see how people in the goldmine worked and used to work. Litle touristic. As the asked for tips on two times during the tour. At the end you arrive in a museumshop with some nice stones which you can buy. Not all from the mine you just visited.

382775844.name: Caution! Tourist trap!
382775844.author: a TripAdvisor user
382775844.reviewBody: We were taken here on a day trip from Mexico City to Cuernavaca and Taxco. It is a fabricated place that aims to sell cheap silver jewelry to tourists. We also were stuck here for a mediocre lunch because there was no place else around. I did find some trinkets to take home and prices are OK. But there are much better independent stores around. This place is meant to line your guide\'s pockets and not more.

345687413.name: Nice silver to view
345687413.author: a TripAdvisor user
345687413.reviewBody:
This silver factory is a tourist place visited by the tour buses.  The store has very nice silver products but the prices are not competitive with the local shops that are seen later in your tour.  

They use high pressure sales from your local tour guide to the in-store sales personnel pressuring you to make purchases.  Overall, it was an alright place to visit and learn about silver.  

Lunch is provided upstairs for our tour.  Very average at best.  Did not sit well with us overall!

323678498.name: What a wonderful distraction of an attraction!
323678498.author: a TripAdvisor user
323678498.reviewBody: We were just walking by... when a very nice gentleman invited us to come in and explore the museum, and we\'re happy that we did. It was quite interesting, and provided us with a perspective into silver mining that gave us a better appreciation of the importance that silver has had upon the town of Taxco. My girlfriend grew up in Taxco and used to make silver, so it was even more interesting for her, and visiting the museum triggered many wonderful memories for her and gave us a lot to talk about. Definitely worth a visit!

167574636.name: Not much silver for a ton of stones
167574636.author: a TripAdvisor user
167574636.reviewBody: We learn that the earth is not easy giving away the silver. Some 50g on 1000kg of stones that are carried out of the mountain by children who could creep still deeper inside ... once upon a time in the west. Now we have technologies, and the silver goes to the US where it is blended to the required qualities than send back for the Mexican handcrofts.

137215113.name: Closed
137215113.author: a TripAdvisor user
137215113.reviewBody: This museum is closed but some of the items have been moved to a little store near the Cathedral.  I was disappointed.

120175660.name: Award winning silver pieces
120175660.author: a TripAdvisor user
120175660.reviewBody: Lots of \'wow\' factor to the museum.  Silver sculpture created specifically for national competitions.  Amazing craftmanship.

675462735.name: True local life scene
675462735.author: a TripAdvisor user
675462735.reviewBody: I have traveled Mexico for nearly 8 years and have seen 22 of the 32 states.  I feel at home here.  However, this was the first time I saw someone being severely beaten up.  A man was attacked by two other men until he was nearly unconscious and bleeding and then unceremoniously thrown in the back of a pickup.  He had attempted to steal a watch from a tourist.  Justice was quick but gruesome.  I never felt comfortable around the plaza borda after seeing this.  Flat spaces are at a premium in hilly Taxco so the plaza itself is small by comparison so it is packed with vendors, tourists, cars, pedestrians, etc.  Not a calm place to be.

645551172.name: Fun to look
645551172.author: a TripAdvisor user
645551172.reviewBody: Although we\'ve been here many times, this last visit we spent more time exploring all the shops and museums and cafes and streets. We will be back again!

634275091.name: Right on the plaza
634275091.author: a TripAdvisor user
634275091.reviewBody: This is on the Zocolo of Taxco, and is the house where the important Se\u00f1or Borda lived when he developed the mines of Taco and became the most wealthy man in Mexico.

587708416.name: Good people-watching
587708416.author: a TripAdvisor user
587708416.reviewBody: A pleasant, shady plaza in front of the cathedral, filled with trees, people chatting and playing, little kids with their mothers, birds.  A great place to relax before or after exploring the winding paths of the market place with all the fruits and vegetables and housewares.

574716085.name: over crowded souvenirs sales
574716085.author: a TripAdvisor user
574716085.reviewBody: Disappointed with number of cheap souvenir sales people and the "come in" calls of shop owners, did not find this square "intimate and charming".

511589261.name: "Such a wonderful place"
511589261.author: a TripAdvisor user
511589261.reviewBody: Enjoy all the sounds, smells and tastes of Taxco in a single place: Plaza Borda!  Just relax and let time fly by while you enjoy!

501926766.name: Not so great
501926766.author: a TripAdvisor user
501926766.reviewBody: You can see lots of very expensive silver items here but it is not so great.  If you want to see royal jewelry you will enjoy your visit.  They do give complimentary drinks that will kick you off your feet, however.  The salff are very friendly and knowledgeable.

495703437.name: Shopping
495703437.author: a TripAdvisor user
495703437.reviewBody: Lots of silver stores. But that is what Taxco is all about. Some nice restaurants. Nice area to people watch.

466368629.name: This is the beating heart of the city.
466368629.author: a TripAdvisor user
466368629.reviewBody: This plaza is absolutely charming. Seems always busy and popular, filled with energy. There are many places of interest around the Plaza Borda. It is nice to choose one of the cafes as your stop. Silver shops have impressive selection of souvenirs and jewelry.

462586013.name: One of the prettiest in Mexico
462586013.author: a TripAdvisor user
462586013.reviewBody: This plaza is absolutely gorgeous.  At night time it can be filled with families, music and dancing.  The star lights in the trees are so pretty, definitely one of the nicest in Mexico.

457482205.name: Small place with santa prisca church
457482205.author: a TripAdvisor user
457482205.reviewBody: It is a small central plaza with Santa Prisca Church and a lot of silver shops. A nice place to enjoy.

445206093.name: excellent
445206093.author: a TripAdvisor user
445206093.reviewBody: It is main Plaza next to Cathedral, Marcado, bars, restaurans and of course shops with silver. Nice place with the trees - so You can find the shadow in very sunny days. It is worthy to roam a little bit - find nice narrow streets, sit and drin coffee or...tequila

435638893.name: Loved it but Beware!!
435638893.author: a TripAdvisor user
435638893.reviewBody:
I, along with my family, loved hanging out at the Plaza Borda for a few hours.  It is beautiful and wonderful for people watching and shopping for silver if that is your thing.  The interior of the Catholic church is capable of causing sensory overload.  Just sit in the church and take your time observing all the architectural features.  It is worth it!  

The Plaza has it all, good food (that I will review separately), good coffee (as a Cuban-American I was impressed by Cafe Punto del Cielo's Cuban coffee), delicious nieves and helados (icees and ice cream at Tepoznieves).  

My one caution:  From the moment you pull into Taxco you will be bombarded by young men wanting to give you tours, show you where to park, and sell you stuff.  They work for tips, and while I admire their industriousness, I for the most part wanted to be left alone and explore around on my own with my family.  That is just how I prefer to experience a new place.  Also, no matter where you go, you are bombarded by knick knack vendors and people trying to get you into their restaurants.  Try not to let this aspect of Taxco be too off-putting; it is definitely a place you'll want to visit.

430710460.name: Beautiful
430710460.author: a TripAdvisor user
430710460.reviewBody: Another beautiful area of Taxco. Such a pretty place to visit with lots of silver shops and places to relax.

404593593.name: charming plaza
404593593.author: a TripAdvisor user
404593593.reviewBody: one of the most charming plazas we\'ve visited in Mexico!  It\'s small with many mature trees, benches and a bandstand.  Tin star-shaped lights dangled from the trees, giving the plaza a real fairy tale ambiance as dusk settled over Taxco.  3 locals in costumes from the Borda era strolled around and were happy to encourage photos.

380021551.name: The Mexican folklore at its best
380021551.author: a TripAdvisor user
380021551.reviewBody: Excellent plaza to watch the local people and to taste icecream at Tepoznieves. Also there are plenty of shops around it to take home souvernirs.

379833408.name: If you are in Mexico city, don\'t miss a visit to Taxco colonial  silver mining city
379833408.author: a TripAdvisor user
379833408.reviewBody:
We stayed in Mexico City and took a day tour to Taxco. It is about 3 hours drive but worth the effort.

It is the main silver colonial city during Spanish times, you will be tranported back in time, the plaza and surrounding streets are marvelous.

Very enjoyable.

376599225.name: 1st Annual Artisan Market
376599225.author: a TripAdvisor user
376599225.reviewBody: Glad to be there for the 1st #artisanmarket. A great start with craft beer from Iguala, embroidered blouses, soaps made from bees honey and a variety other artisan crafted items. Looking forward to the next!

355521899.name: The heart of Taxco
355521899.author: a TripAdvisor user
355521899.reviewBody: A wonderful central square at the city of Taxco. It has a certain atmosphere, one could describe it as romantic, with red bricks, a gazebo and benches at the center, nicely decorated with illumineted stars. There are many shops and restaurants around the square and one has a perfect view of the baroque beauty of Santa Prisca. It was certainly worth the long drive from Mexico City and I wished I could have stayed much longer...

338791438.name: Stunning...
338791438.author: a TripAdvisor user
338791438.reviewBody: The Plaza Borda is one of the most beautiful town squares that I have ever visited. Taxco is built on the side of a mountain and stretches upwards and downwards from its central square Plaza Borda. At that level, it is very similar to Amalfi or one of the other Italian towns along the Naples/Sorrento coastline. What enhances both the Plaza and Taxco altogether is that nothing is allowed to be altered in favour of tourism, money or just plain old easier living. The houses, the buildings, the central square are all amazing, but the jewel in the square\'s crown is the Iglesia de Santa Prisca. Standing in a corner of the Plaza, this magnificent church, with its Churrigueresque facade and ornate sculptures, dominates Taxco. No expense was spared in its construction between 1751 and 1758. The church, with its solid silver sculptures inside,was paid for by Joseph de la Borda, who had made his own fortune by discovering important and large deposits of silver around Taxco. What a gem!

338139515.name: Quaint but Happening Place
338139515.author: a TripAdvisor user
338139515.reviewBody: Loved Taxco... Plaza Bordo is where everything is happening.  Visit the cathedral first, then enjoy the shopping, interactions with the store merchants and street merchants and enjoy a great lunch.  I love this town!

333928854.name: PLAZA BORDA
333928854.author: a TripAdvisor user
333928854.reviewBody: This lovey plaza is next to the Santa Prisca  Cathedral, visited a while back, lovely pruned trees, lovely rotunda and benches to sit were you can take in the beauty of the Cathedral,also enjoy watching the people.

318981365.name: "PLAZA bORDA"  FANTASTIC CORNER OF THE WORLD.
318981365.author: a TripAdvisor user
318981365.reviewBody: I am Mexican, I  lived in Mexico City for 33 years,and when I was a teenager we used to go to Acapulco, three times a year.  Stayed on our way in Taxco and enjoyed two days walking around Plaza Borda, a little town, full beauty, it was like going to Italy, From the top or our beautiful hotel, Mexican style "Mi casita"  we used to enjoy the view of the whole town.  I went last year, with my family, We had great time."WHAT A BEAUTY"   all the little kids, speaking in English to you, and selling souvenirs.  Something you do not see in Canada or USA.  This little kids, dealing with  the tourism, that bargains a lot.  These  kids are very happy to do this, and learn English at the same time, when they will grow up, probably would be good business men.  And happy people.  I would go again to stay for a week,  Around Plaza Borda, there is many restaurants with delicious food  and is very cheap to stay there.\n

293276712.name: A welcoming plaza to rest one\'s feet and people watch
293276712.author: a TripAdvisor user
293276712.reviewBody: I love this little zocolo. It is engulfed with pruned trees adding shade throughout the day. This is one zocolo in Mexico where one can purchase some fine watercolor painting of the town; beware, if you like it, buy it, don\'t expect to come back the next day and find the same artist. I did that only to find not a single artist the next day, so I waited for them to return on subsequent days; I was not disappointed.

240151757.name: Rest and relax here
240151757.author: a TripAdvisor user
240151757.reviewBody: I especially enjoyed the popcorn, made fresh in the evening, and the band which plays on Thursday nights.  The Plaza is full of teenagers, but when the band plays the people dancing are mostly from middle age to (very) elderly.  Try on one of the straw hats that the strolling salesmen vend.  They have figured out how to make them comfortable.  They are 80 pesos (70 if you insist), I bought three.

233192069.name: Where it\'s at!
233192069.author: a TripAdvisor user
233192069.reviewBody: I was here at Christmas, and so the charming little town was swarming with tourists, mainly from Mexico City. There is not, frankly, much too do in Taxco, except shop for silver, so I spent a fair amount of time in this lively plaza, as seemingly everyone else in town!

226825996.name: A place to rest
226825996.author: a TripAdvisor user
226825996.reviewBody:
The Plaza Borda is the market place located in front of the great Cathedral in the centre of Taxco, Mexico.
We passed by Taxco on our way to Acapulco and had a very nice stay.

Taxco is an old silver mine city, however the mine is not active since three years as workers gone on strike and no agreement could be found regarding the prevailling working conditions. Taxco has a lot of Silver shops around the Plaza Borda, as well as small restaurants with roof top terraces.

207495601.name: Meeting Point
207495601.author: a TripAdvisor user
207495601.reviewBody: This is the main meeting point of the inhabitants of Taxco. It is the main attraction of the tourists, too. All the interests are at hand here. Sit down and enjoy.

189163618.name: A Nice Place to People Watch
189163618.author: a TripAdvisor user
189163618.reviewBody: Although a bit touristy, Taxco\'s tourists are mostly from Mexico City\u2026it\'s not the Mayan Riviera overrun with Americans.  The Plaza Borda is a great place to sit, watch the people, listen to the mariachis and marvel at the hundreds of white Volkswagon taxis which constantly go around the square.

167575034.name: Plaza Borda is the Z\u00f3calo
167575034.author: a TripAdvisor user
167575034.reviewBody: Mira a la descripcion del z\u00f3calo. It is the same place, and it is corresponding nicely with the church. Contemplation and admiration, inside looking out, outside looking in?

125907340.name: Lovely mexican atmosphere
125907340.author: a TripAdvisor user
125907340.reviewBody: We loved everything about Taxco. We normally stay away from very touristy places and Taxco certainly is touristy, but it seemed to us to be mainly Mexican tourists. We didn\'t see any tourist busses or large groups with guided tours. And we were even there on Dia de Muertos. The square is a lovely and one of the prettiest plaza\'s we\'ve seen in Mexico. It\'s surrounded by beautiful colonial houses with red tilled roofs. everything is kept in white and dark red which really adds to the beauty of this place. A special and very charming feature are the 200 original white beetle taxis that climb the steep streets of Taxco. We could sit for hours under the trees and watch all the beetles drive by. We even made a miniature video with all the cars that you can see on Youtube (Beetles in Taxco, un Pueblo Magico, Mexico). On the night of Dia de Muertos there was a small but lovely parade on the square and the kids were doing "trick or treat". The restaurants on the square are not fantastic and a bit overpriced. But most of them have an upstairs balcony with amazing view over the square.

122543032.name: The place to be day and night
122543032.author: a TripAdvisor user
122543032.reviewBody: This busy plaza is always buzzing with activity. People from all over the world can be found here in the silver shops, cafes and restaurants. Beautiful traditional baskets, wall hangings, painted pottery and the like can be bought for a song from the multitude of indigenous street vendors selling their handmade products. Extremely friendly locals and plentiful helpful police make this plaza feel very safe.

121222255.name: Small and charming
121222255.author: a TripAdvisor user
121222255.reviewBody: Where the locals hand out. As it was a Saturday afternoon and a fiesta or two were happening the place was really alive

120175833.name: Bustling shaded plaza full of life
120175833.author: a TripAdvisor user
120175833.reviewBody: I\'m not incredibly familiar with Mexican plazas but this one was a joy.  Artisans, hawkers, schoolkids, seniors combined with pleasant seating under laurel trees.  Restaurants and shops surround the square and continue along any of the streets leading off.  Lots of life here!  And of course the domination of the church on one side and the statue of Christ on the hill above town...beautiful.

22555593.name: A very pleasant plaza
22555593.author: a TripAdvisor user
22555593.reviewBody: After hiking up and down the hills of Taxco it was nice to sit and rest for a while in this small but nice little square. It is right in the middle of much in Taxco with the main church (Santa Prisca) right next door plus museums, hotels, restaurants, and many of Taxco\'s silver shops within minutes. The square is cute and has a number of benches for that few minutes of rest.

662435604.name: Ex-convent of San Bernardino de Siena
662435604.author: a TripAdvisor user
662435604.reviewBody: This convent was built in 1592  with adobe by Francisco de Torantos. But a  fire accident destroyed it so it was rebuilt with a Neoclassic style. In this place it was signed \u201c El plan de Iguala\u201d. This convent it\u00b4s  a place where you can learn about Mexican  history and art.

itemReviewed.name: Ex-convento de San Bernardino de Siena

569589377.name: Old and ver\u00e9 simple
569589377.author: a TripAdvisor user
569589377.reviewBody: Its a Bety old stone Wallis, But in the inside is ver\u00eda very simple compares to the others,  so do not for get to wear very comftable because you will walk

itemReviewed.name: Ex-convento de San Bernardino de Siena

643367235.name: Jewellery lovers delight
643367235.author: a TripAdvisor user
643367235.reviewBody: For anybody that is interested in Jewellery and art, this Museo is a must.\nThe locals are very proud of William Spartling and how he put Taxco on the map,

587708010.name: interesting small museum
587708010.author: a TripAdvisor user
587708010.reviewBody: a small museum not far from the central plaza.  Exhibit of photos from various Mexican villages of religious celebrations; also exhibits of Sprawling\'s very elegant silver jewelry.

465335717.name: WILLIAM SPRATLING museum
465335717.author: a TripAdvisor user
465335717.reviewBody: If you are already a fan of William Spratling\'s designs you will love this museum.\n If you don\'t know who William Spratling is go to this museum and you will leave with knowledge of his legacy and art.

361346670.name: Good not great!
361346670.author: a TripAdvisor user
361346670.reviewBody: Some pottery from Spratlings collection. Interest exhibit (temporary) about indigenous language groups in Mexico. Smallish exhibition of Spratling designs and work.

356862494.name: Guillermo Spratling Museum
356862494.author: a TripAdvisor user
356862494.reviewBody: Very nice museum well worth the $40 Pesos entry fee.  A tribute to Spratling who ment so much to Taxco and the people who live here. Modern displays of photographs, artifacts, and silver pieces.  Mostly in Spanish only.

349017610.name: Good display for lovers of design
349017610.author: a TripAdvisor user
349017610.reviewBody: Behind the Parroquia. Inconspicuous, but well worth the 40 pesos. Good sample of Spratling\'s work and his history. However signage is in Spanish only.

258588803.name: Exhibits his collection of pre-Columbian art as well as his wonderful silver designs.
258588803.author: a TripAdvisor user
258588803.reviewBody: Guillermo Spratling did much to develop the art and commerce of silver in Taxco, and many of his original designs are displayed here.  The museum is well-organized and very impressive.  Go there.

189162241.name: Beautiful Silver Pieces!
189162241.author: a TripAdvisor user
189162241.reviewBody: Nice little museum dedicated to Guillermo Spratling, a New Yorker who came to Taxco in the 1930s and started the modern silver jewelry tradition here.  Looking at some of his own silver designs, you see how great the silver was back in the day and see how not so great it is now, in comparison.  There are also some pre-Columbian pieces here as well.

180994299.name: Go See it
180994299.author: a TripAdvisor user
180994299.reviewBody: When in Taxco go by this museum.  It will give you a great deal of background on how Taxco became world renowned for its silversmithing.  Informative and fun.

156690716.name: I wanted to like it
156690716.author: a TripAdvisor user
156690716.reviewBody: Actually we didn\'t see much of the museo. Each time we tried to go it was closed. Then when we finally went past and the doors were open, we went in and were told there were only 20 minutes before it closed. We asked if we could take a quick look as we were leaving the next morning.  The woman told us yes, but we would have to pay the full entrance fee. Somehow, that seemed unreasonable to me, and so we left without seeing anything more than we could see by the door. However, we had been lucky enough to get an invitation to the William Spratling Ranch, and that was much more interesting.

156163733.name: an american in Taxco
156163733.author: a TripAdvisor user
156163733.reviewBody: short but most interesting exhibits, specially showing the life of William Spratling and his love for Taxco and the design of silver

148890426.name: A good small museum
148890426.author: a TripAdvisor user
148890426.reviewBody: Well laid out and interesting, gives one a hint of how silver and jewelry came together in Taxco.  Interesting exhibits and artifacts that tell their own history and translates into what is being produced in present day.  Places to sit and a good restroom are a bonus in this museum!

127742891.name: The Man Who Gave Taxco Silversmithing
127742891.author: a TripAdvisor user
127742891.reviewBody: William Spratling was an American architect who came to Mexico to write a book and came upon Taxco, finding it a quiet place where the once great silver mining centre had stalled after the mines were played out. He began teaching local people the art and science of silversmithing in his own workshop and the result was that crafting silver unleashed a creative and economic boom. Today, most of the silver jewellry in Mexico is crafted in Taxco and buyers from around the world come here to stock their retail outlets.\n\nThe museum contains many pre-Columbian clay and stone objects, which unfortunately are of unknown provenance. They are, therefore, interesting pieces, but it would be more helpful to know where they were acquired and from which sites. The rest of the museum is given over to exemplars of Spratlings best works in silver, which are predominantly either pieces of jewellry in the Art Deco style, pre-Columbian style, or a combination of both. Original designs on paper are displayed beside the finished pieces, so it is possible to understand how Spratling\'s design ideas were made real. There are also several contemporary photos. The only thing missing would be English language commentary on the exhibits, but even without any understanding of Spanish, the Museum is highly worthwhile. No photography is permitted.

126674478.name: This is what the town is all about
126674478.author: a TripAdvisor user
126674478.reviewBody: A great place to learn about the history of Silver in the town and the great artisans this place is know for. Go here before you go shopping so you know what your looking at and for.

22555786.name: A small but interesting museum
22555786.author: a TripAdvisor user
22555786.reviewBody: The Spratling Museum was named for American Spratling who was instrumental in getting the silversmith business going in Taxco. I suppose the city owes its current bonanza to him. The Museo is just a minute\'s walk from the main church and the Zocalo (Plaza Borda) in the very center of town. It\'s on three floors and you must pay to get in. One floor was all Chinese artifacts when we were there (November of \'08) and I suspect it was a temporary exhibit. Another floor was full of nice Pre-Hispanic art objects. The other floor had some information on Spratling himself and had some very nice pieces of silver which were from his own collection. The two latter floors seemed to be permanent collections. All was set up very nicely. There is lots of hustling done in Taxco to get you into shops and restaurants. This little museum was a bit of a nice since no one was tugging on you to come in.

675534988.name: Most beautiful church in Mexico. Bring walking shoes.
675534988.author: a TripAdvisor user
675534988.reviewBody: What I love about Taxco is how laid back and non touristy it is, this is really the real Mexico here and I loved my visit to the town. The church is simply gorgeous, pink and white and wonderfully adorned on the inside in traditional Latin American style. Bring walking shoes as it is an extremely hilly city and lots of walking up and down.

668691877.name: Beautiful Church inside and out
668691877.author: a TripAdvisor user
668691877.reviewBody: One of the prettiest churches in Mexico. I have been here twice and would go back again. Its so peaceful to just sit inside the church. If you\'re headed to Taxco, its a must visit.

667202463.name: Amazing church, worth the visit
667202463.author: a TripAdvisor user
667202463.reviewBody: If you are into visiting churches and you are a person who appreciates sacred art and architecture, this church is a must place to visit. The interior is all covered with gold, one of the most beautiful churches in Mexico. It is currently in restoration, but definitely worth the visit.

665565368.name: Stunning example of what wealth and power can create
665565368.author: a TripAdvisor user
665565368.reviewBody:
Built over only seven or so years, the brief time it took to build this church explains its unity of style and its balance of forms.  No money was spared, the best masons and artists of the time were hired.  

Don Jose de la Borda (French) a local prosperous mine owner, had so much money and power when he decided to build this church that neither the church nor the government intervened with the design or with funds.  Complete control of the projects rested in the hands of Don Jose.  

Considered the best example of Mexican Baroque, it is unique in the fact that it is very narrow due to the lack of flat land in Taxco.  For almost 50 years, it was the tallest (94.6 meters) building in Mexico.  

Nine gold leafed altarpieces, a dome covered with colorful talavera tiles and a monumental organ (250 pipes and 1,000 voices) are all parts of what makes this place very exclusive and beautiful.

Don Jose de la Borda had an ulterior motive, that his son becomes the parish priest.  What a way to get that to happen!  

The latest earthquake damaged the church and it is still under repair so about ½ is not open to the public.  My guide told me they expect to be done by September 2019!  I would love to see the whole church.  Let’s hope.

665543224.name: The church altar - magnifique!
665543224.author: a TripAdvisor user
665543224.reviewBody: I\'ve never seen a church altar like this in Santa Prisca! \nThis is art, nearly 500 years old!\nIt\'s a pity, - didn\'t hear this beautiful organ.

662435193.name: Parish of Santa Prisca
662435193.author: a TripAdvisor user
662435193.reviewBody: This Parish was build in 1748-1758. It\u2019s the biggest example of Mexican baroque. In 1759 was considered the higher building in Mexico. Also have a unique organ and it wasn\u2019t built with church money. It\u00b4s a place where you can enjoy time with your friends or family!

656415225.name: One of my favourite churches in mexico
656415225.author: a TripAdvisor user
656415225.reviewBody: Best viewed and photographed in the afternoon when the sun is on the facade to capture the beautiful pink tone. \n\nVery ornate both inside and out with stunning carving. The interior is full of gold painted plaster and wood alters and carvings with one of the most beautiful organs I\'ve ever seen. As it\'s not so big inside as many similar churches in Mexico it also has a nice intimate and comfortable feel.

654815969.name: Another Beautiful Church
654815969.author: a TripAdvisor user
654815969.reviewBody:
Except for the remodel being accompanied on the dome, perfect inside and the steeples are fine.
1. On a most active Zocalo 
2. Interior is very photogenic
