3. The church is the main attraction from any distance including the drive into town

649219938.name: restoration in process
649219938.author: a TripAdvisor user
649219938.reviewBody: The Restoration of the facade and gold leaf interior is in progress. So,in a few years, it will be back to a perfect wonder. It truly is worth the UNESCO designation.

647004568.name: Beautiful Parish inside and outside
647004568.author: a TripAdvisor user
647004568.reviewBody: Located in the heart of the Magic Town of Taxco, Guerrero.\nSanta Prisca is a beautiful parish, inside and outside. You should take lunch or dinner at one the restaurants around Santa Prisca to enjoy the view.

645550571.name: We still love this church
645550571.author: a TripAdvisor user
645550571.reviewBody: It\'s sad that the earthquake has closed down most of this church as far as touring, but it\'s still amazing. We came over a decade before a couple times and did the tour each time. It is amazing, and I hope they eventually open it all back up again. This time we barely saw anything other than the main room.

645546816.name: Astonishing exterior, beautiful interior
645546816.author: a TripAdvisor user
645546816.reviewBody: Take some time to visit it and then have a drink or have lunch at the amazing terraces in front of the church, to keep on enjoying the art, colors and this majestic piece of art.

640755133.name: amazing church - still on restoration
640755133.author: a TripAdvisor user
640755133.reviewBody: The church is very pretty but is still on restoration from last years earthquake. You can get in but you see all the work they are doing inside.

636367697.name: Outstanding architecture.
636367697.author: a TripAdvisor user
636367697.reviewBody: Under construction to repair earthquake damage. Really a beautiful building inside and out. The interior is in good form. We met a government guide who was very well informed and he shared his knowledge with us.

634274839.name: Beautiful Church
634274839.author: a TripAdvisor user
634274839.reviewBody: Amazing that Se\u00f1or Borda paid for the building and decoration of this church out of his own pocket.  It stands out over the whole hillside city.  The interior decoration is an explosion of gold.

632763221.name: Unbelieveable
632763221.author: a TripAdvisor user
632763221.reviewBody: Unreal how magnificent the old churches and other old buildings are in Taxco. We visited the church and got a tour of its history. In the street were many vendors selling their wares that were very reasonably prices. Music in the square added to a nice cultural experience. Quaint shops crowded together inside, outside, upstairs, downstairs, up the hill, and down the hill. Many selling pure silver jewelry at very  reasonable prices. Also places to eat within this circle. You could spend several hours here. Restrooms are hard to come by. Usually a "local street guide" (who needs a tip) has to show you where one is located.

603680871.name: Magnificently Beautiful
603680871.author: a TripAdvisor user
603680871.reviewBody: Went to Taxco from Mexico City with Mexcity Tours to visit one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen Santa Prisca Church. This church was built in 1748 and took only 9 years to build. It is unbelievably magnificently beautiful inside.

587706011.name: Colonial church
587706011.author: a TripAdvisor user
587706011.reviewBody: Santa Prisca is on the small central square of Taxco.  The interior is ornate, baroque, and in its own way very appealing.

587412856.name: Beautiful baroque church
587412856.author: a TripAdvisor user
587412856.reviewBody: Located right in the center of town, in front of the Z\u00f3calo this is a beautiful baroque style building built in the18th century.  The visit to Taxco is more than worth it just to admire this gem.

581843445.name: Totally impressive
581843445.author: a TripAdvisor user
581843445.reviewBody: Beautiful catholic church with a nice story, once you go inside you will be amazed, make sure you go with a small tour group so you can enjoy more...

577100101.name: Gold in the Silver City?
577100101.author: a TripAdvisor user
577100101.reviewBody: A cute little church and in a charming town. We came here as part of a day trip from Mexico City. The reliefs are wonderful, and the pure silver statue of Guadalupe was astonishing.\n\nThe most shocking to me was in a city known for silver the reliefs were gold plated, why not silver?

574715329.name: simple interior
574715329.author: a TripAdvisor user
574715329.reviewBody: There were quite a few people wanting to be our guide, but this is only a small church and our books sufficed.

574094620.name: Under renovation whilst we were there
574094620.author: a TripAdvisor user
574094620.reviewBody: Fantastic building but due to renovation work (it will look amazing when finished) a lot of it was covered over whilst we were there.  It sits right in the edge of the Zocalo, right next to the signage for Taxco so makes a great backdrop for a photo, especially if you can get a VW beetle in the pic too, it summaries the town!

570160584.name: Covered in Gold to Distinguish Itself in the Silver Town
570160584.author: a TripAdvisor user
570160584.reviewBody: With a town full of silver, the church sets itself apart with an inside covered with gold. It is relatively small, but is gilded to the hilt with eye candy in every direction. It is the highlight of the zocalo.

569588803.name: This is a great town
569588803.author: a TripAdvisor user
569588803.reviewBody: But in this same town has plenty chuches, this es very simple compared to be cathetral, you will walk a lot

569187453.name: Amazing church done in the barroque style
569187453.author: a TripAdvisor user
569187453.reviewBody: this place is amazing to detail,, beutifull wood work and great style, seems imposible with the tools back then, and what amount of time to carve stone and wood in such a form

568828866.name: Quick trip
568828866.author: a TripAdvisor user
568828866.reviewBody: Amazing  architecture, incredible design and beautiful color, across of the church,  is located the Zocalo, where you can seat and rest, or eat an ice cream, a Jello or just to chilling out.

566352917.name: Must see
566352917.author: a TripAdvisor user
566352917.reviewBody: Imagine building this almost 350 year ago on this steep hill! Man with a vision. People with dedication. Spend time on the square to look at people. Come early and enjoy the  tranquility, but also be there later to ee the hustle and bustle.

565795162.name: Cute Hotel close to the Zocolo
565795162.author: a TripAdvisor user
565795162.reviewBody: This cute hotel is just blocks from the zocolo and the staff is very accommodating and helpful. The hotel is quite and just a few minutes from the bus station. They have a beautiful garden that I spent a lot of time in just to read or catch up on emails. The rooms were comfortable and gives you a good view of the city.

561824371.name: Amazing
561824371.author: a TripAdvisor user
561824371.reviewBody: To go there and visit this Church and not come away amazed is impossible.\n\nThe workmanship of how this was done is hard to fathom. Coming to visit this city for Santa Prisca alone is well wortj the visit.

561543858.name: Excellent signature cocktails
561543858.author: a TripAdvisor user
561543858.reviewBody: While we didn\u00b4t partake of any food, we can attest to the unique nature of four of the signature cocktails found on their menu. There were also some other mentioned by our server that were not on the list

558915195.name: Pueblo Magico...Sure was!!
558915195.author: a TripAdvisor user
558915195.reviewBody: Went to this amazing town.. Taxco.\nOne of many Pueblos Magicos designated by Mexico.  As I entered its perimeter on the highway..my mouth and eyes opened wide.  Its view from stop was astounding. Its rooftops..Its facades..Its Church.. \nJust beautiful..Walking on its cobble-stoned marrow streets..A must see..

552042901.name: dont miss this place
552042901.author: a TripAdvisor user
552042901.reviewBody: can be crowded but its worth to see it! dont miss it! all this "pueblo " is amazing with great and friendly people

549209800.name: Enchanting Chapel!
549209800.author: a TripAdvisor user
549209800.reviewBody: Santa Prisca Church is a barroque monument of the 18th century. All the  altars are baroque churriguerresque.They show their spanish influence and the sincretism of two cultures: aztec and european .Santa Pristina is also famous for his organ which stands at the second floor balcony.Backwards you can find out a museum which keeps some classical paintings around 16th century. Basically portraits of priests and main figures of the tiem. The chapel is surround outside by marigold flowers fields.An excellent place to check barroque churrigueresque art. Nice visit to enjoy.

526156604.name: Magnificent
526156604.author: a TripAdvisor user
526156604.reviewBody: It\'s a great place to see the architecture that it has, every single detail, the put into the church

522104721.name: Santa Prisca Church
522104721.author: a TripAdvisor user
522104721.reviewBody: Santa Prisca Church and the plaza is a great historical and architectonic jewel. The view is beautiful inside and out. Around there you will find good restaurants, silver jewelry stores, and hotels. The view of the church at night is amazing. If you like to take photographs this is the perfect place to take the most beautiful pictures. My sons who are 23 and 24 years old loved the visit to Taxco and Santa Prisca.

517994247.name: Take the tour
517994247.author: a TripAdvisor user
517994247.reviewBody: We took the time to enjoy a free history tour and although I\'m not religious I enjoyed the honest information.  This particular church has some unique history as well.

511990802.name: Impressive.
511990802.author: a TripAdvisor user
511990802.reviewBody: Wonderful cathedral with an important role in the history of the town. There are official tour guides that give a short tour for a small fee. A must see.

501925656.name: Beautiful cathedral with amazing history
501925656.author: a TripAdvisor user
501925656.reviewBody: Be sure to visit this wonderful cathedral at the Zocalo in Tasco.  Ask about the history and tour the property.   You will probably never see so much gold in all your life.  It was built very rapidly - in about seven years - but it is huge and beautiful.

498714573.name: Amazing
498714573.author: a TripAdvisor user
498714573.reviewBody: Santa Prisca is nice. The inside of the church was stunning gold shrines altar is amazing I wish to go back to Taxco Mexico.

495701291.name: amazing
495701291.author: a TripAdvisor user
495701291.reviewBody: Beautiful. Right in the middle of the Zocalo.  Inside is unbelievable. Needs a little dusting, but still great.

493802492.name: Great place to get married
493802492.author: a TripAdvisor user
493802492.reviewBody: Was married there 35 years ago. A very special place for me and my wife. Great history and well maintained.

490093828.name: A must
490093828.author: a TripAdvisor user
490093828.reviewBody: It is situated in the main square, it is a very beautiful baroque style cathedral. It is a catholic temple made of quarry stone (cantera) which is a pink stone extracted from mines in Mexico.

486701641.name: Amazing
486701641.author: a TripAdvisor user
486701641.reviewBody: Was a very exited experience!!!!! Its a beatiful place in Guerrero, Mexico! You lost your mind and there is a very good food all the are nice and friendly! Recommended to go!

486136910.name: Beautiful Cathederal!
486136910.author: a TripAdvisor user
486136910.reviewBody: Went on day tour from Mexico City to Taxco. It included tour of the silver museum and Santa Prisco. Lunch had a great view. The included lunch was nice, but a little under seasoned for my taste. Santa Prisca was beautiful and very interesting. There was actually a funeral there.

485992371.name: Beautiful baroque church on the Z\u00f3calo
485992371.author: a TripAdvisor user
485992371.reviewBody: This beautiful church is directly at the Z\u00f3calo. It is a lovely baroque church that I visited for the 2nd time. \nIt was built between 1751 - 1758 by Jos\u00e9 de la Borda, who had made a fortune in the silver mines. It is built with pink stone flanked by two towers which are highly decorated in the upper part. The cupola is covered in coloured tile. \nInside there are a number of altarpieces covered in gold - opulent.

476607132.name: Probably the most ornate church I have ever visited.
476607132.author: a TripAdvisor user
476607132.reviewBody: \n I recommend getting a guide to talk you through all the art work. There are som controversial pieces such as a pregnant Virgin Mary without symbolic bow covering her belly which caused much hocus pocus that artist wasn\'t allowed to sign pieces... So in Belgian artist started painting himself and family members in some of the latter pieces.\n

474096276.name: Worth a visit while in Taxco
474096276.author: a TripAdvisor user
474096276.reviewBody: This is one of the site that is a must while in Taxco.  The cathedral is typical of the colonial era and well worth the time to explore.  Some guides will offer their services but it is not necessary to enjoy the visit.  We went during an afternoon during the week and had ample time to visit as there were only a few other visitors.  If you have read about the history of Taxco and the Santa Prisca before your visit, you will benefit more.  Since the cathedral is located in the centre of the city, you can make a day of it be having lunch or dinner in one of the many restaurants around the zocalo.

473698529.name: Stunning!
473698529.author: a TripAdvisor user
473698529.reviewBody: Read the story of the cathedral before you go so that you can appreciate it when you arrive. For us at least, the crowds were so huge that it was difficult to hear any of the descriptions from local guides. The story and the architecture is really amazing. When done, go to the plaza and have a drink or a meal or just watch the crowd!

469754926.name: Beautifull cathedral
469754926.author: a TripAdvisor user
469754926.reviewBody: Beautifull colonial cathedral. All days open to public. Nice view over the city from the terrace on the right side of the church.

469200424.name: Prominent church on the hill
469200424.author: a TripAdvisor user
469200424.reviewBody: Tall, narrow baroque style church built between 1751 and 1758. St Peter and St Paul on either side of door. Only find churches with two front towers in Catholic or parish churches. This is a parish church. Believe he called it St Prisca or St Sabastian. Lots of gold and gold displayed.

466393078.name: It dominates
466393078.author: a TripAdvisor user
466393078.reviewBody:
Located at the very center of the plaza , there is absolutely no way you can miss it . It's a beautiful baroque church , you can get a guide beforehand or outside if you wish. 

The silver "Virgen de Guadalupe" is a must see, Blessed by the Pope last February . It has two views so be sure to check the back! 

Loved the Organ !

466361502.name: Beautiful Spanish Baroque.
466361502.author: a TripAdvisor user
466361502.reviewBody: Before the Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel was built the Church of Santa Prisca was the tallest structure in Taxco. It is located west of old city. Tall, narrow, opulent and lavishly rich looking interior is truly breath-taking. The general style is Spanish Baroque. The church has nine impressive gold covered altars. The main altar is dedicated to Santa Prisca and San Sebastian. Beautiful paintings by  Miguel Cabrera decorate the church.\nSanta Prisca de Taxco Cathedral is a true pearl of local architecture and not to be missed during the exploration of the city.

464358785.name: Enjoy history with a tour!
464358785.author: a TripAdvisor user
464358785.reviewBody: Santa Prisca Cathedral is certainly a site not to miss on your visit to Taxco.  The cathedral is located at the zocalo and you can obtain a free tour ( with a voluntary donation / tip) from guides located at or around the entrance to the church. Tours are available in Spanish and English. The tours last approximately 20 minutes and will explain the history of this magnificent structure.  We found the guide to be knowledgeable, friendly and willing to answer our questions.

464278080.name: Stunning
464278080.author: a TripAdvisor user
464278080.reviewBody: great architecture, very well preserved.  our visit was short but we left full of impressions. Great historical value.

463859683.name: Santa Prisca
463859683.author: a TripAdvisor user
463859683.reviewBody: This Cathedral has an amazinc Barroque influence, it was built by Juan de la Borda, the richest  mine owner in colonial times, built in pink stone it is trully a beautiful building

459835632.name: Awesome architecture
459835632.author: a TripAdvisor user
459835632.reviewBody: Definitely worth a visit!  The design of this cathedral & the location in Taxco are impressive and peaceful.

459541958.name: Majestic architecture steeped in history
459541958.author: a TripAdvisor user
459541958.reviewBody: This is a beautiful cathedral built with pink stone in the baroque style. It is located in the main plaza of Taxco which is in itself a splendid setting. Inside are nine floor-to-ceiling altar pieces covered with gold. The main altar piece is dedicated to the two patron saints Santa Prisca and San Sebastian. We were  fascinated by the tall silver statue of the Virgin de Guadalupe. As we were lucky enough to visit during Epiphany many locals were having their children baptised or blessed. In addition, there was a full Catholic Mass with several priests participating. It was a very uplifting spiritual experience. Everyone in the congregation was most welcoming and didn\'t seem to mind that they had been invaded by tourists! They were all beautifully dressed in honour of Epiphany.  My husband and I were respectably dressed in 3/4 trousers. I wore a short-sleeved top and my husband wore a  short-sleeved shirt. This excursion was one of the highlights of our Mexican holiday. There was a fairly heavy army presence in the square so we felt very safe.

457621809.name: Visit to the City center and Main Cathedral
457621809.author: a TripAdvisor user
457621809.reviewBody: We visit the cathedral on our trip to Taxco and I have to say the building was very impressive.  It is not as big as Puebla\'s Cathedral but, considering the small touristic town, it was very majestic. I recommend staying for a service so you get a feeling of the local customs in church.   \nThis is at the side of the city center or zocalo where you will find many silver markets or tianguis as known locally.  Be careful to look and quote before shopping there are many stores that will charge more than double the price because of the location.  \n

457480248.name: Visit to history
457480248.author: a TripAdvisor user
457480248.reviewBody: Santa Prisca church it is a mist in Taxco. Its design churrigeresco type is very beautiful. The church is open to turist from 4 to 6 pm on sundays. Other times there is always a catholic mass.

456701452.name: You must see this church
456701452.author: a TripAdvisor user
456701452.reviewBody: The history in this magic city is everywhere. This church is a must when in town no matter how long your stay is you MUST WALK THROUGH HERE! The day we went there was a mass for a baptism and we sat there for 45 mins or so and walked for another 45 just admiring the detail ever inchhhhhh of it. This church houses one of the largest sliver statues of the Virgin de Guadalupe. I was not able to see it in February when I first visited because it was sent to Mexico City to be blessed by the Pope. I did however return in June and was able to see this in person. The z\u00f3calo is alive in the morning, afternoon and evening. Sit on a bench, take in the sights... have some esquites and maybe catch some live music as well.

450038065.name: Amazing baroque church
450038065.author: a TripAdvisor user
450038065.reviewBody: It\'s a must see when in taxco ! Make sure you get a guide for a few pesos and emerge in all that history ! \nIn front of the cathedral there is a beautiful floral arrangement.... one of my favorite city in Mexico

448305693.name: Angie Australia
448305693.author: a TripAdvisor user
448305693.reviewBody: Beautiful church. Built in the Baroque style. Free to visit. Its beautiful at night. Situated right across the way from agua Escondida hotel on the Zocalo.

445193585.name: Impressive
445193585.author: a TripAdvisor user
445193585.reviewBody: Sometimes I lead pilgramage tours to Mexico. Taxco is one of the best palaces on the way. Santa Prisca  is build in Chirrugurresco style - the mMexican Barocco style. Main fasade and interior is amazing. And a lot things to see around.

442000016.name: Wow
442000016.author: a TripAdvisor user
442000016.reviewBody: It\'s almost worth the trip to Taxco just to see this cathedral. Over the top ornate and it just dominates the city skyline with its size. \n\nGet a guide as there\'s too much in there to figure out on your own, but use one of the ones that are credentialed by the city.

438196648.name: The view and the silver
438196648.author: a TripAdvisor user
438196648.reviewBody:
If you don't want to spend a couple of bucks in silver (you can find good quality and bad quality for a wide range of prices), then just go to the Agua Escondida terrace (it is also a good hotel/spa), ask for a local craft beer and sit to enjoy and decipher each crave on the façade of this beautiful cathedral. 

From the towers to the portico, each detail is exquisite to the eye. The bells paint the sky with sounds at noon, while the sun illuminates the whole city. 

Once you are done with your beer, go down, go in and look to the magnificence of the sacred art, particularly to the "Virgen de Guadalupe" made of a ton of silver. 

Yes, I know, lots of people complain about the sellers and how reliable is the silver quality in here, but I guess if you go beyond shops, there is much to see about a town that Hernán Cortés claim to himself after giving it to one of his lieutenants (it was too much of a gift, I think...)

427875298.name: Most impressive
427875298.author: a TripAdvisor user
427875298.reviewBody: Stunning both externally and internally. Do seek out the side chapel with very interesting murals. The interior is a feast for the eyes.

425728019.name: Lovely old building
425728019.author: a TripAdvisor user
425728019.reviewBody: Definitely worth a look. It\'s free entry some guys will ask if you want a tour but you can say no and just have a wander through.\n

403451875.name: Hire a tour guide!
403451875.author: a TripAdvisor user
403451875.reviewBody: There are lots of men standing outside the cathedral eager to give you a tour. We paid 150 pesos - which was well worth the investment. Our guide was very knowledgeable and we enjoyed learning about the history of the town, the founding family, and the architect. Even our 8 year old was enthralled!

400794577.name: Beautiful Santa Prisca
400794577.author: a TripAdvisor user
400794577.reviewBody: I  have to admit I was not expecting the inside of Santa Prisca to be golden color on a Silver Town. The Cathedral is very pretty.

391879260.name: Its a beautiful cathedral!
391879260.author: a TripAdvisor user
391879260.reviewBody: OMG...Taxco, it\'s wonderful, its quaint narrow cobblestone streets, with this beautiful Cathedral in the center of town with its baroque architecture and just stunning inside.  something you wouldn\'t expect to see in such a quaint town.  It was beautiful and made more special since it was a place my parents had visited on their honeymoon, a place my mother had to sit and remember (my father is gone now) it just made the whole experience that much (more) special.  A great place to explore, lots to see.

390349699.name: Cool offerings
390349699.author: a TripAdvisor user
390349699.reviewBody: Colonial-style catherdral with insane amount of silver offerings on display that make the visit very unique and memorable. Easy to find.

386772985.name: Taxco pueblo magico
386772985.author: a TripAdvisor user
386772985.reviewBody: The cathedral is beautiful but the town is magical, the streets are very charming. I took a little bus to go to the Christ on top of the town and the view is unique. \nWorth visiting this town

384991038.name: A must see.
384991038.author: a TripAdvisor user
384991038.reviewBody: Beautiful chuch! Full of history, it\'s in the center of town. A must see. Everything is within walking distance. Great for families and friends.

383762479.name: The Santa Prisca cathedral is on the main square in Taxco,Mexico acreoss from the gazebo and some Restaurants
383762479.author: a TripAdvisor user
383762479.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old carved stone Cathedral on the main square of the silver city of Taxco,Mexico.The town is nestled between two mountains in Mexico and the drive on the way is very scenic.

383165005.name: Beautiful church!
383165005.author: a TripAdvisor user
383165005.reviewBody: Beautiful church both inside and out!  Can see both Roman and Aztec cultures.  Locals will offer to give you history for tips. We didn\'t try as we had to leave to catch our tour but very nice people.

380019263.name: An elegant cathedral fully ornated with golden leaves
380019263.author: a TripAdvisor user
380019263.reviewBody: Make sure to get a guide to learn all the interesting details of the history of the cathedral, there are several guides within the premise that offer their services in different languages.

379833806.name: Colonial church built with  Aztec temples pyramid stones
379833806.author: a TripAdvisor user
379833806.reviewBody: If you are in Taxco visit this magnificent colonial church and you will better understand how colonization and turning locals to the Catholic faith was done in Mexico. The colonial Silver capital.

375948149.name: Step back in time
375948149.author: a TripAdvisor user
375948149.reviewBody: Truly one of the most amazing cathedrals I have seen in Mexico. During our visit the Philharmonic Orchestra from Acapulco performed right in front of the church. Beatlemania!! Magical :)

367993218.name: Stunning!
367993218.author: a TripAdvisor user
367993218.reviewBody: I don\'t feel it necessary to recommend seeing this, because you\'re going to if you visit Taxco. Like many cathedrals, it takes your breath away the moment you step inside. We were approached by a knowledgeable gentleman named Gerardo who offered to share the history of the church. We tipped 70 pesos and it was well worth it. There were organized tours that were much more expensive. I\'m happy we went with the local.

366432086.name: Big Cathedral
366432086.author: a TripAdvisor user
366432086.reviewBody: Big Cathedral for such a small town.\nThe twin towers and detailing are excellent.\nStands proud in front of the Zocalo

366270268.name: Glorious cathedral
366270268.author: a TripAdvisor user
366270268.reviewBody: Santa Prisca Cathedral is well worth a visit whether or not you are religious.  A fine example of Spanish architecture.

359771500.name: Beautiful Cathedral
359771500.author: a TripAdvisor user
359771500.reviewBody: A must see while in Taxco.  This Cathedral is a must visit for any first time visitor to Taxco.  For that matter, it should be a stop on all trips to Taxco.  Such a wonderful ornate Cathedral in a "Pueblo Magico".  Must see!

355518357.name: Wonderful church
355518357.author: a TripAdvisor user
355518357.reviewBody: The church is interesting to see from inside, but it is definitely an eyecatcher and something like a trade mark of the city from outside. It\'s so wonderfully ornated and a joy to see from different angles at and around the main square. Just make sure to look out for the white taxis while taking pictures.

350943107.name: Worth it
350943107.author: a TripAdvisor user
350943107.reviewBody:
The trip to Cuernavaca and Taxco is very long almost 3-4 hours depending upon the traffic.
It's worth it depending upon your interest. You'll need a good walking shoes and hat to cover your head during dry season. Prepare yourself for long walk at her than that you'll enjoy this place.
I love it and I'll come back.
Enjoy.

349516144.name: An Extremely Baroque Church in Taxco
349516144.author: a TripAdvisor user
349516144.reviewBody: The Santa Prisca Church (I\'m not so sure that it is a catedral) may be the chief reason to visit Taxco.  Built by Sr. Borda, and apparently costing him a large portion of his fortune, it is an extremely ornate church.  Remembering that Borda lived in the the mid 1800s, Santa Prisca was built in a Rococo style to imitate the art of 100 years before.  You could spend a few hours attempting to photograph every gilded angel and saint.  We were lucky enough to catch a late mass the night before leaving Taxco and the singing in the darkened church brought our a religiosity that was lacking during our tour the day before, when it seemed to be more of a pure tourist attraction.  \n\n    Somehow, this church did not speak to me in the way that several of the churches elsewhere in Mexico did.  If you are coming to Taxco solely to see this church, you might want to reconsider your choice.  Impressive, yes.  Miraculous?  maybe not.

349282269.name: Impressive work
349282269.author: a TripAdvisor user
349282269.reviewBody: The cathedral was incredible to see. We had a quick visit and just before we left we met a guide who asked if we would like an explanation of its history.  His discussion made us stop and really look at all the detailed drawings, carvings, etc that we had previously just glanced at.  This is definitely the most intricately detailed cathedral I\'ve seen and well worth a walk through if you have a few minutes to spare in Taxco\'s zocalo.

345580618.name: Gold, Silver, and creepy saints
345580618.author: a TripAdvisor user
345580618.reviewBody: Beautiful church covered in gold. It is incredibly peaceful with some of the creepiest Jesus sculptures I have ever seen.

344402598.name: Just like any other cathedral
344402598.author: a TripAdvisor user
344402598.reviewBody: There is nothing so special that may interest you. Its like any other cathedral and it is at the town centre so a good place to hangout.

340657739.name: Incredible
340657739.author: a TripAdvisor user
340657739.reviewBody: This would have to be the most impressive cathedral we have visited. The exterior colour changes as the day gets longer and the interior is awe inspiring.

340568459.name: Historical
340568459.author: a TripAdvisor user
340568459.reviewBody: I came here several years ago and the most amazing thing is the view of the church and the interior is totally different from other churches I have visited. Most of the decoration are made out of gold, most of this decorations are from the Spanish era and still in great condition. Also the local government keeps it nice for other generations to see and enjoy.

336640638.name: I have always loved the church in Sienna...
336640638.author: a TripAdvisor user
336640638.reviewBody: From the moment I saw the church in Sienna, Italy, I have always said that this is the most beautiful, stunning church in all of Europe and we\'d seen quite a few. However, now that I have seen Santa Prisca Cathedral, I\'m undecided. Why? This church is ornate the same way as Sienna but even in one colour, pink it is most beautiful! It is also from our guide in Sienna that we heard about Mr. Poinsett, where the word poinsettia came from. In front of the church are lovely poinsettia\'s. According to our guide, Taxco is proud to have them in front of the church/zocalo every year! They were just lovely.

336460260.name: Old, Historical, Ornate
336460260.author: a TripAdvisor user
336460260.reviewBody: A must-see when visiting Taxco.  Be surrounded by locals in deep study and prayer; the faithful singing and praying inside still welcome the tourists and guides.

329398977.name: Big bold and beautiful
329398977.author: a TripAdvisor user
329398977.reviewBody: What a delightful church is just a spectacular location, this is a village that is indeed pretty as a picture.

328084898.name: Amazing!!! This Cathedral is so Beautiful !!
328084898.author: a TripAdvisor user
328084898.reviewBody: I was impressed when I saw  the Cathedral, is so Beautiful!  When I was en Taxco in 2014 I stayed al The Villas Monte Taxco, very good nice place

325210141.name: Rich
325210141.author: a TripAdvisor user
325210141.reviewBody: The location of the cathedral is already nice, the inside outstanding. It\'s immediately recognizable that Taxco was a rich town. Kilos of gold have been used for the decoration.

323676520.name: I get mesmerized every time...
323676520.author: a TripAdvisor user
323676520.reviewBody: Every time I walk through this cathedral, I get mesmerized. I love to look upon it at night from across Taxco, and see it lit up against the night sky. The best time to see it is when there is an event of some kind, perhaps the days prior to Easter, when there are all sorts of processions which fill up the Zocalo and create a broad splash of color that leads into the church. This of course is best seen from one of the balcony\'s high up in some of the restaurants located along the edge of the Zocalo. I\'ve attended mass here on several occasions while visiting family, the people are very welcoming, warm and friendly.

321247239.name: Beautiful!
321247239.author: a TripAdvisor user
321247239.reviewBody: The most beautiful church I have seen in Mexico. Very ornate, tour guides are informative and work for tips.  Definitely take the time to see the amazing architecture and art work housed in this church. The .999 silver virgin of Guadalupe is stunning.

319598443.name: "Incredible and with a privileged location"
319598443.author: a TripAdvisor user
319598443.reviewBody: As almost all churches Santa Prisca is located in the zocalo of the city (Taxco`s central park) but as Taxco is a small city it makes its location even better than average. Surrounded by trees, several markets and a quite busy daily activity that confabulates into the zocalo, Santa Prisca looks fascinating! As all churches in Mexico, the building`s inside and overall architecture are beautifully preserved with incredible details and a vast history to share.

318427874.name: It\'s the center of life.
318427874.author: a TripAdvisor user
318427874.reviewBody: The town revolves around the Cathedral.  I\'s a beautiful place first. It\'s an active part of the community.  We watched no less than four weddings one Saturday from inside and outside the church.  There are at least 7 restaurants that have balconies where one can watch the comings and goings while eating lunch or dinner. There are come dislikes that always surround the opulence of the Catholic Churches in the midst of such grinding poverty, but, that\'s a topic for a different forum.  There is, indeed, many fine examples of colonial are and architecture and one can spend hours just look around at the paintings and carvings.

317625583.name: Santa Prisca by day and by night.
317625583.author: a TripAdvisor user
317625583.reviewBody: Santa Prisca has a wonderful facade which will never fail to give you beautiful pictures. If you can visit on a Saturday, you will find that "quincea\u00f1eras" (girls turning 15) come to have a Mass here for their friends and family, before holding their party at a reception hall or retaurant. It is surprising to see  the church decked with wonderful bouquets of flowers, which are quickly changed when the next "quincea\u00f1era" comes in. We were told that as many as 8 girls will pass by this church on any given Saturday. Very interesting custom....

315285016.name: SANTA PRISCA CATHEDRAL
315285016.author: a TripAdvisor user
315285016.reviewBody: Santa Prisca Cathedral is so rich inside, visited a while back. It has such grand side alter that a so beautiful, while we were there they had a funeral.

309312913.name: Situated in the Zocalo.
309312913.author: a TripAdvisor user
309312913.reviewBody: Some of the most gold leaf I have ever seen.  Located in the center of the colonial town Taxco, Santa Prisca Cathedral is exquisite.  Being repainted with the help of donations, it stands out even more among the white walled homes with red roofs and striking purple crepe myrtles.  Meeting place for friends and lovers, everyone visits the Cathedral.

306771141.name: Don\'t miss it!
306771141.author: a TripAdvisor user
306771141.reviewBody: This is the heart of Taxco; a lovely Cathedral with some very ornate architecture.  Activities are constant here, and the Zocolo is always bustling

306127574.name: Mexican Art Baroque
306127574.author: a TripAdvisor user
306127574.reviewBody: This church is one of the best representative of the hispanic baroque period located in Taxco, Mexico.

298188328.name: Amazing Carvings
298188328.author: a TripAdvisor user
298188328.reviewBody: Stunning little cathedral with ornate carvings of icons on each wall. Beautiful light and a peaceful place to ponder or pray.

293270064.name: Santa Prisca\'s changing light.
293270064.author: a TripAdvisor user
293270064.reviewBody: Throughout Mexico there are beautiful zocolos and cathedrals. In Taxco the Santa Prisca Cathedral stands out as one of the beauties among beauties. The stone is pink and the exterior light shifts throughout the day - changing the pink to many tones: beige, orange-pink, red-pink it is a delicious sight to experience. The exterior and interior architecture is a delight to the eye with the outstanding detail. This is a cathedral to visit again and again; experience it early morning, mid-day, to early evening and night with light reflecting and highlighting the exterior.

281222246.name: The gem in the crown of the magical town of Taxco
281222246.author: a TripAdvisor user
281222246.reviewBody: This a beautifully detailed church inside and out. There is daily mass Outside is the main plaza are several restaurants and bars to enjoy this view. This plaza is always lively, especially more so when there are events going on. Come in the mornings and enjoy some coffee from Cafe Punta del Cielo, get a shoe shine, and read the news. At night there is music on the weekends and there is always great street food offered up like churros, pan dulce, tacos, elotes, and esquites. For more reviews and recommendations in Taxco cocinax.com/travel/taxco-guerrero

280987624.name: Sadly Beautiful
280987624.author: a TripAdvisor user
280987624.reviewBody: A beautiful building with stunning features, but sad in that there are so many beggers on the steps. Although not as much poverty as in other cities in Mexico, there is poverty in Taxco, especially among the Indian population. Seeing an elaborate church while there are poor people begging makes one uncomfortable.

278617763.name: Most Beautiful church so far...
278617763.author: a TripAdvisor user
278617763.reviewBody: This church by far is the most beautiful we\'ve seen in Mexico yet. The depth and abundance of the gold leaf, hand painted wood carvings is remarkable. This is a gem for Taxco in the center of the zocalo. Highly recommend a visit. Enjoy a dinner at one of the several restaurants where you can enjoy the view of the mountainous surroundings and the Sta Prisca church.

278544775.name: Beautiful Taxco Cathedral
278544775.author: a TripAdvisor user
278544775.reviewBody: This is a lovely Cathedral built in the 1700s.  The interior is opulent, peaceful and serene.  It sits on the town square of Taxco where you can buy beautiful silver jewelry.

273115342.name: Impressive
273115342.author: a TripAdvisor user
273115342.reviewBody: Impressive cathedral located near the zocalo. Its construction has been financed by Jos\u00e9 de Borda, a french adventurer who made his fortune in silver mines in the area. Heavily decorated inside, it\'s really impressive.

272193921.name: Can\u00b4t leave Taxco without seeing it
272193921.author: a TripAdvisor user
272193921.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a most in Taxco. If you come, this is definetly the place to go, also make the best of the trip and walk around the cathedral for a while.. you\u00b4ll find all kinds of interesting things.

271036933.name: The center point of a picturesque city
271036933.author: a TripAdvisor user
271036933.reviewBody: The facade of the cathedral is the most famous view associated with Taxco. Indeed, the tall, intricate towers and carved center part of the cathedral look beautiful. You\'ll like the interior if baroque is your thing (not mine). The surroundings of the church are breathtaking - walk around these steep and narrow streets and enjoy the feel of a small but rich mining town of the past. There is a nice view of the cathedral from a street parallel to the opposite side of the square - don\'t miss it!

270457735.name: Excursion with Language School Students
270457735.author: a TripAdvisor user
270457735.reviewBody: Cathedral of Santa Prisca and the statue of Cristo at the top. The whole area was breathtakingly beautiful. I did not buy any silver but this place is famous for its silver and there are many vendors who sell silver. The zocalo was filled with visitors. I enjoyed talking with the local people and it just so happened that there was a wedding with a mariachi band playing. Lots of fun. I visited all the ancient churches although there was a lot more to see.

269740529.name: Beatiful
269740529.author: a TripAdvisor user
269740529.reviewBody: A beatiful church with an nice history. Every detail is amazing and ut is propably the best attraction in Taxco.  At night is amazing.

263338099.name: Truly a beautiful church
263338099.author: a TripAdvisor user
263338099.reviewBody: This church is beautiful inside and out, the architecture is very old, and in good condition. Taxco is a lovely town to visit, quaint streets made of stone, with inlaid patterns made of white stones to be seen everywhere! Great views of the church can be found in the upper terrace levels of the restaurants across the street!

261630630.name: Shimmering Silver in the mountains
261630630.author: a TripAdvisor user
261630630.reviewBody: After an indeed very long journey on a van from Mexico City, I was wondering if it was worth all the effort and time as we approach Taxco as nothing seem spectacular. However as we enter the town, we did not expect something like a Capri right in the middle of nowhere in Mexico. This is a Capri without the sea. Narrow cobbled streets, nice restaurants, quaint shops and their treasure, the Santa Prisca Cathedral. You really do need a local guide to tell you the significance of this site. It was built by a silver mine tycoon who only son turn to priesthood and so did his daughter. Wander round the town and get lost in the many streets. It is certainly an enjoyable experience.

260362701.name: A Must Visit in Taxco!
260362701.author: a TripAdvisor user
260362701.reviewBody: Santa Prisca Cathedral was built back in the 1700s by a French Miner, who discovered the silver mine in Taxco. It is the center of the town and on top of the hill. Big cars are not accessible to the cathedral. You can park the car elsewhere and take a taxi (there are many taxi in Taxco) there. After visit the cathedral, you can check out the stores around. All most all of them sell silver accessories. Amber pendants can be found if you spend time looking around. Do remember to bargain!

259664008.name: Must see cathedral
259664008.author: a TripAdvisor user
259664008.reviewBody:
FREE! You don't need a tour guide, but its a better way to see the church, with all the details pointed out. (Does Jesus have a belly button?) Take notice of the beautiful floor and the ceilings. This place always seems to be under construction, but each detail is so elaborate, its understandable. Its a quick walk through the church, but be quiet and enjoy the details. Cameras are allowed.

Do yourself a favor, scope out the local shops if they have a patio for a nice view. Seeing the church from other directions is just as neat as seeing the inside. Watch out for the zocalo trees. The birds will drop a few white bombs on your head!

Do yourself a favor and walk down the streets BEHIND the cathedral. There are some amazing shops back there.

258259026.name: Its size location on the zocalo on the hillside makes it an impossible sight to miss
258259026.author: a TripAdvisor user
258259026.reviewBody: If you spend time in and around the zocalo you can\'t miss the cathedral. Kept quite well inside but not as decorated as some other cathedrals in Latin America. Best appreciated from the outside.\n

256064609.name: best part of my vacation
256064609.author: a TripAdvisor user
256064609.reviewBody: I spent a long weekend visiting Cuernavaca, Xochicalco, and Taxco, and this cathedral was the highlight of the trip. Both the interior and exterior are done exquisitely.

252887388.name: A gem of a little church
252887388.author: a TripAdvisor user
252887388.reviewBody: One of my first visits upon arriving in Taxco..  Is this Church of Santa Prisca...Very tipical of the best Colonial Churches in Latin America..\nA real Gem...A quiet restful place to sit and reflect after exploring Taxco......With it\'s winding streets..

250638344.name: Eglesias de Excellento
250638344.author: a TripAdvisor user
250638344.reviewBody: Just looking at the outside compels you to wander in gaze in adoration at the architecture and incredible carvings. The gold embossing on almost everything is quite the sight. A must see for all. You don\'t have to be religious to appreciate this historic building.

248421323.name: Like a gem!
248421323.author: a TripAdvisor user
248421323.reviewBody: This beautiful cathedral is like a gem in this ancient "silver city". We visited in Christmas time, so there were a lot of decorations and the square in the front of the main door were filled with pointsettias!

247805325.name: unmistakable proof of the past richness of the town
247805325.author: a TripAdvisor user
247805325.reviewBody: I liked the facade and the interior of beautiful sculpture. every time of the day is good for visiting

242207848.name: Something special
242207848.author: a TripAdvisor user
242207848.reviewBody: The Cathedral of Taxco is something must to be seen in Mexico, changing colours from early morning to evening offers all the time breathtaking view. Simply gorgeous!

227817013.name: Gorgeous!
227817013.author: a TripAdvisor user
227817013.reviewBody: This cathedral was different than anything I had seen before: pinkish, of a gorgeous novohispanic baroque style and really tall, so that it is really impressive.

226824959.name: The golden Church
226824959.author: a TripAdvisor user
226824959.reviewBody: The Cathedral of Taxco is really beautiful und builds kind of the centre of the very mediterranien and cosy silver mine city.\n\nThe Cathedral is located at a market place and from the outside as well from the inside looks amazing and is definitely woth a look.

225902348.name: Beautiful setting, albeit a bit crowded
225902348.author: a TripAdvisor user
225902348.reviewBody: We made a mini daytrip to Taxco - clearly our 1st stop was the cathedral. It is absolutely breathtaking inside and out. The only issue were the crowds - it was jam packed, but it being a Saturday normal I suppose. I would suggest taking the help from a guide so you can get the full description and explanation of the cathedral and art inside. We didn\'t and I have a feeling we missed out in a few details.\nAfter Santa Prisca, we headed out to the saturday Silver Market, the prices were lower than downtown - (Though barely no room for bargaining I was surprised to find!) and the vendors will in fact tell you if the pieces are merely silver platted or actual silver (plus you can always look for the .925 mark) - we did find however that there are more specialised or "designer pieces" available in the workshops closer to the cathedral - much more expensive, but not to be found in the market at all. My only issue really was the amount of people trying to pull you from one place to another, since I assume they get a commission for people they take to X restaurant or silver workshop, they are everywhere and can be pretty insistent. Just say "no gracias!" And keep walking. \nStill, all in all, Taxco has a charm beyond words - lose yourself in the narrow and frighteningly steep little cobbled rows, away from the crowds - never know what you might find!

213467632.name: Good experience
213467632.author: a TripAdvisor user
213467632.reviewBody: Santa Prisca is a must-see in Taxco, the cathedral\'s inside is just beautiful, Taxco is a really small city, so if you are already there, you should consider visiting this cathedral.

209459252.name: Magnificent
209459252.author: a TripAdvisor user
209459252.reviewBody: I am not a religious person but I always visit the cathedrals when in a mexican city. The beauty therein is tremendous. Words fail me.\n\nThis was paid for by Jose de la Borda,  a spaniard made wealthy through the silver mines of Taxco. The building was tha tallest in Mexico from 1758 until 1806.

207490249.name: Main Cathedral
207490249.author: a TripAdvisor user
207490249.reviewBody: Santa Prisca Cathedral is made with rich baroque style. It is a masterpiece of its own. No effort or money is saved while constructing this beautiful church. This is a must if you visit Taxco.

197183049.name: Quite impressive.  You should read about it before you visit it as the explanations of the tour guys are not enough
197183049.author: a TripAdvisor user
197183049.reviewBody: Get amazed at the gold on the walls and the altars of this 16th century old church and understand the wealth of this country and the pillage that the Spanish conquerors did to Mexico and its indigenous people.  An artistic jewel from the Churrigueresco (Baroque) style.  Other than the insistence of services by the tour guys in the main square there Is nothing to dislike about this site

195744563.name: Stunning cathedral in the silver city of Taxco
195744563.author: a TripAdvisor user
195744563.reviewBody: Taxco in itself is a very nice place because of its location and its whitewashed houses. In the middle of the city you\'ll find the Santa Prisca cathedral, one of the most famous monuments in the whole of Mexico.

195133649.name: Surprising
195133649.author: a TripAdvisor user
195133649.reviewBody: I was honestly not expecting this church. Walking up to it, the facade was impressive enough. Inside however was something to behold. It is ornate beyond belief and very much worth seeing. A must if visiting Taxco.

193711595.name: A must see unbelievable craftsmanship
193711595.author: a TripAdvisor user
193711595.reviewBody: They have tours of the Cathedral and they sell a book regarding the detailed history of Santa Prisca Cathedral. I would recommend both.  They are currently restoring the gold leaf and Mass is still being said at the Cathedral.

193481685.name: Beyond Barroch: CHURRIGUERISCO!
193481685.author: a TripAdvisor user
193481685.reviewBody:
On February 6th, we enjoy a tour CUERNAVACA AND TAXCO ( Ta-S-S-co, not TAX company TAXCO... Took a while to say right...) But the historical facts, wonderful jeweleries, and charming central
Park are highligths of this excursion. Taxco has a wonderful catholic church in Barroc ( XVI century) style, dedicated to Saint Prisca and St. Sebastian, but the architect in charge, did go a step further: made it even more " Barroch" creating his own style, named after him after his last name "CHURRIGUERA". This very intense, overcharged style is worth the visit. A majestic Air Organ crowns the chorus, and the sole idea of enjoying a concert (
According to our guide twice a year) there, do made me start planning to return here for a rest vacation... And concert a this work of art, The Santa Prisca catholic church... And San Sebastian!

193204901.name: A Gorgeous Church - Rivals any seen in Europe
193204901.author: a TripAdvisor user
193204901.reviewBody: We were pleasantly surprised at how gorgeous this church is!  All we could say when we entered was a quiet WOW!  All the altars are 18 or 24 carat gold and the statues and carvings are exceptional.  An enterprising man offered us a tour and it was worth it.  All for a modest tip.

190787042.name: A beautiful work of art.
190787042.author: a TripAdvisor user
190787042.reviewBody: This cathedral has stood the passing of time, its construction is magnificent, its finishes are breathtaking. Laminated gold over wood is what make this gorgeous cathedral come to life in the inside. It is undergoing a very long and much needed maintenance.

190216760.name: Wonderful
190216760.author: a TripAdvisor user
190216760.reviewBody: A beautifully kept church, the nochebuenas outside of the plaza just embellished the view. Its a must on any trip to taxco

190014674.name: Impressive
190014674.author: a TripAdvisor user
190014674.reviewBody: Impressive Cathedral in the Baroque style. A fortune was invested in the building. The decor in gold is stunning. One of the main attractions in Taxco if not the main.

189162344.name: Quite a Building!
189162344.author: a TripAdvisor user
189162344.reviewBody: Built on the fortune of De Borda, Taxco\'s most famous person, in the 18th Century, Santa Prisca is a very impressive cathedral.  The carvings on the bell tower are amazing and inside, all the gold is overwhelming.

188663741.name: What a nice church
188663741.author: a TripAdvisor user
188663741.reviewBody:
The Church of Santa Prisca is a must to see while visiting Taxco. The baroque style of this building is amazing and the interior is remarkable. The main altar reminds me of Toledo’s (Spain) main altar. 

The church is the town’s main point of attraction and it’s very easy to get to from the bus station.  If you arrived by bus (Estrella Blanca) get off at the station, cross the street and take the street up the road. On your way to the church from the Estrella Blanca bust station you will go through the market, so don’t worry if for some reason you find yourself among the products or meat section. Just follow the road and that will take you to the church.

If you are planning in taking nice pictures of the church (main altar), try to visit the church after the service because first, you are not allow to take pictures while there is a mass going on and second because there were less people crossing in front of your camera.

187982622.name: Must See in Taxco
187982622.author: a TripAdvisor user
187982622.reviewBody: Amazing Cathedral at the town\'s main square. The Rococo style at his best. A lot of ornamentals, gold color is everywhere. I especially liked the 18th century Spanish Organ. The Altar is also very beautiful. You can get a local guide near the Cathedral, it highly recommended. A great day tour from Mexico City.

187610873.name: Breathtaking!
187610873.author: a TripAdvisor user
187610873.reviewBody: If you do nothing else in Taxco, let a local guide you through this awe inspiring cathedral with soaring bell towers and 100 foot + or - alters gilded in 24 caret gold.

184518716.name: Spectacular church.
184518716.author: a TripAdvisor user
184518716.reviewBody: This is a fantastic church with amazing artwork and details inside. The sponsor, Borda sunk a fortune into building it and as you walk around inside you will be amazed at all the craftsmenship that went into it.

184359725.name: Incredible
184359725.author: a TripAdvisor user
184359725.reviewBody: one of the most beautiful things you will ever see, take the time to learn the history of this church and the town and the people it will enrich your life...my wife and I went with another couple and the entire town was amazing

183722489.name: U must ser this.debes verla
183722489.author: a TripAdvisor user
183722489.reviewBody: Quick and awesome. Take pics. R\u00e1pido e incre\u00edble.toma le fotos.\nU need many coins of one peso for the poor kids. The are outside of sabra prisca church.lleva monedas para los ninos q piden dinero.if u can buy toys its a good idea Taxco its very nice pkace but the people its too poor :(

178067172.name: Beautiful Exterior/ Outstanding Interior
178067172.author: a TripAdvisor user
178067172.reviewBody: The front entrance was being worked on, once inside its a spiritual experience. The attention to detail on the 3 dimensional interior wall art was magnificent.

176638479.name: I agree with taking a guided tour
176638479.author: a TripAdvisor user
176638479.reviewBody: We were absolutely enchanted by the story and the random facts about this building. For example, the artist of the religious paintings inside the church put himself in all of them! Kind of like photobombing his own art. Also, we had never seen a painting depicting the circumcision of Christ, I mean, most people back then didn\'t even want to think about the fact that Jesus himself was a Jew. We found all this utterly interesting. Also, the little square outside of the church is very charming and you will find very cute crafts for purchase. Plus, do not forget about buying silver jewelry. Silver from Mexico never tarnishes and the artistry is one of a kind.

173065773.name: Must see building with a paid guide
173065773.author: a TripAdvisor user
173065773.reviewBody: Great history behind this building, the architecture is amazing. It is recommended to read before going and also pay a guided tour, it\'s worth it....

171512232.name: Beautiful Cathedral
171512232.author: a TripAdvisor user
171512232.reviewBody: See with a guide if you can (in Spanish).  Impressive cathedral.  Wood carving with gold plate right near the center of town.

167951169.name: Always amazing
167951169.author: a TripAdvisor user
167951169.reviewBody: The Santa Prisca Cathedral is definitely a must see if you are in the Guerrero vicinity. I have been to Taxco countless times but had never taken my children. From the outside it is simply monumental. Once inside I was again impressed by the beautiful golden altar and incredible artwork. It is living proof of the treasures found in Taxco!

167573887.name: open for admiration
167573887.author: a TripAdvisor user
167573887.reviewBody: The center of the ancient colonial towns is the church near the zolaco where the people meets - still, today. Relaxed, outside looking, playing, talking, inside the church preaching or looking, believing or not. It is up to You.

164847400.name: Beautiful!
164847400.author: a TripAdvisor user
164847400.reviewBody: The beauty of this Cathedral is the interior. The sculptures and ornamentation within are truly breathtaking. Please be kind in preservation and abide by the signs indicating that no- flash should be used when taking pictures

164210527.name: Churrigueresque towers
164210527.author: a TripAdvisor user
164210527.reviewBody: Thanks to the wealth of the area from silver and the generosity of one man Jose de la Borda this church was built ...... this providing that his son Manual could act as priest there.  Set in the middle of Taxco it is surrounded by local shopping, restaurants and the passing of daily life. Very intricate work inside - magnificent wood carvings covered in gold leaf. Look out for those Churrigueresque towers!! Cannot fully explain them - suffice that our guide said it, and spelled it, just so we could write it here!

164111329.name: Grand and magnificent church
164111329.author: a TripAdvisor user
164111329.reviewBody: our tour guide from WAYAK tours failed to inform us of the history of this church , He was more concerned on taking us to a silver store . Luckily , we entered this church in the square of Tasco and there was a guy there who for a small donation explained to us the history of this church . It was built by a french guy named Borda who came to Mexico looking for his brother Francisco. He found his brother who at that time already owned a gold as well as a silver mine. When Francisco died he left the mines to his brother . The brother  has 2 children , a son who became a priest and a daughter who became a nun. He was the one who had this church built in honor of Sta. Prisca  (Priscilla) He hired 4 architects to draw the design and had 2500 workers executing and building the church. The only condition he gave to the archbishop in building the church was to permit his son to be the first priest assigned there . The main altar depicts Christ  apostles and the pope at that time , the heart of Jesus , Sta Prisca and the Virgin Mary . On the left side of the altar , the bishops and on the right side the cardinals . The facade of the church is also beautiful and it was the one that attracted us to enter it. It is sad that it seems the concern of our tour guide from WAYAK TOUR was just to bring us to a silver store. One of the member of our tour even commented that " it was a long way just to go to a silver shop"  The square of Tasco is lined with stores selling silver but the guide brought us to one shop and that was all and then took us to a restaurant for lunch at 3:00 p.m which we declined as we have taken ours in our first stop .

163090023.name: Mexican barroque
163090023.author: a TripAdvisor user
163090023.reviewBody: A great example of the Mexican barroque that shows the wealth produced by the exploitation of silver during 3 centuries, at least. You can easily skip the guides, just come in and enjoy. Please avoid service time since the poor priest is interrupted at all times by impatient tourists.

159848941.name: The Highlight of Taxco Center
159848941.author: a TripAdvisor user
159848941.reviewBody:
Beautiful cathedral in the tourist center of Taxco
The side altars and decor is spectacular
Restaurants and shops abound the plaza
Free outdoor performances on Sunday evenings.

159832930.name: do NOT miss....
159832930.author: a TripAdvisor user
159832930.reviewBody: This cathedral is right on the square and especially for the size of the city, one of most impressive churches I have seen in Mexico...just beautiful...the detail inside is amazing...you will enjoy it mucho

155461811.name: Lovely church and square around it
155461811.author: a TripAdvisor user
155461811.reviewBody: Lovely situation throughout the area the church was highly visible loads of shops  and cafes surrounding it . We had a great meal at a place tucked away upstairs called Marios highly recccomend it .  Seaman Santa festivals started so all very interesting.

151273809.name: Yet another pretty cathedral
151273809.author: a TripAdvisor user
151273809.reviewBody: It is situated on the edge of the zocalo and whilst we were there mass was being celebrated do we didn\'t stay overly long. However located where it is its day to find and view

146796636.name: Amazing history..
146796636.author: a TripAdvisor user
146796636.reviewBody: My partner and i were in the cathedral taking photos (without a flash of course) when a local approached us and gave us an amazing tour of the cathedral - including its history. Defiantly worth the look

145903408.name: Beautiful
145903408.author: a TripAdvisor user
145903408.reviewBody: If memory serves me right, the monies to build this church were donated by a man whose only request was that his son would serve as the priest here until he died. This church also has the only know painting of Mary, mother of Jesus, pregnant. We had an English speaking guide and it was wonderful. Set on the city Square, beautiful and well worth the visit.

145179450.name: Santa Prisca Cathedral
145179450.author: a TripAdvisor user
145179450.reviewBody: This is the best preserved cathedral I\'ve seen in Mexico. It gives you insight into the depth of the faith this family had that built the church. It\'s a must see if you are in Taxco.

143219037.name: Sunday morning
143219037.author: a TripAdvisor user
143219037.reviewBody: We attended the childrens\' mass and it was overwhelming. The mass, activities, homily, songs were directed to and by the children. The sermon was acted out by future actors. I was very impressed at how well the mass flowed reaching out to parents and children both, reminding both of their possibilities.\nIf we return to Taxco again, we will certainly attend this very special service.

137215081.name: Wow
137215081.author: a TripAdvisor user
137215081.reviewBody: A beautiful cathedral in the heart of the city.  Unfortunately I didn\'t get to take a tour but they do offer them in English and Spanish.  Wonderful!

136254904.name: Guide was great!
136254904.author: a TripAdvisor user
136254904.reviewBody: Check out Jesus getting circumcised. It\'s one of the few paintings of this historical moment in the world.

128451232.name: Amazing
128451232.author: a TripAdvisor user
128451232.reviewBody: Got to see this lovely church.  Full of gold leaf and art.  And what a history.

126674248.name: A must see
126674248.author: a TripAdvisor user
126674248.reviewBody: Beautiful old cathedral. Gives you the real feeling of how old this town is.

125906822.name: Fascinating!
125906822.author: a TripAdvisor user
125906822.reviewBody: This church is amazing and even if your normally do not like to visit churches you might want to pop in and see the many amazing altars. We were there on Dia de Muertos which added to the magical atmosphere in this beautiful city and especially around the main plaza where the Cathedral is located.  We normally stay away from very touristy attractions, but we still enjoyed this place and it really wasn\'t very packed. No tourist busses or big groups of guided tours - at least when we were there.

124359613.name: Beautiful sample of the art in the colony.
124359613.author: a TripAdvisor user
124359613.reviewBody: A visit is a must while in town. Get a tourist guide to get a full explanation. Guides are inside waiting for you.

123987064.name: A must see when in Taxco
123987064.author: a TripAdvisor user
123987064.reviewBody: Take the time to visit this sight. The church is located in the towns "Zocalo" and is a gathering place for the towns people.

123312701.name: Interesting church
123312701.author: a TripAdvisor user
123312701.reviewBody: This church showcases the wealth of Taxco in days past.  The altar is quite nice, as are many other adornments.  Afternoon is a great time to photograph the outside facade....to get a vantage point walk uphill a bit from one corner of the plaza and turn onto a level street to find the viewpoint.

122612127.name: Historic Cathedral
122612127.author: a TripAdvisor user
122612127.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture and wonderful history.  Lot\'s of street vendors surrounding the cathedral and many restaurants around with beautiful views of the church and surrounding city and countryside.

122550372.name: Super Awsome Cathedral
122550372.author: a TripAdvisor user
122550372.reviewBody: The atmosphere is abundant & impressive. I felt like I could not take it all in, especially behind a lens.

122542164.name: Gorgeous Architecture
122542164.author: a TripAdvisor user
122542164.reviewBody: A beautiful old structure in the center of town. We were luck enough to catch the end of an a tour leader\'s lecture about the history of the church. The back part was under construction at the time of our visit, but most areas were accessible. Don\'t miss the extremely beautiful wooden doors!

121222233.name: Beautiful church
121222233.author: a TripAdvisor user
121222233.reviewBody: An orchestra was playing when we attended so that was an added bonus.

120897586.name: very nice...under construktion
120897586.author: a TripAdvisor user
120897586.reviewBody: the place was under construktion...and we couldnt see all of it

97259938.name: Incredible place and the nicest and kind people
97259938.author: a TripAdvisor user
97259938.reviewBody: The town leaves you breathless, it is like being inside a picture, so beautiful, so innocent, and at the same time traditional and magnificent. You can feel Mexico, their architecture, the small plaza with its friendly and hospitable people, you feel their kind and warm heart welcoming you to their town. The food incredible, and the tour to the Cathedral and the prices for taxis and food is very reasonable. The city welcomes you with a lot of friendly security personnel, guiding you to the places of your interest, kindly and respectfully.  I recommend that you use comfortable shoes.

22556296.name: A lovely church from the outside and very nice inside too
22556296.author: a TripAdvisor user
22556296.reviewBody: This lovely church has a commanding place in central Taxco. You can see it as you approach the city and also from various spots around town. It is gorgeous and lovely inside too. It\'s worth spending some time taking a close look. It was built in the 18th century and is quite a piece of Baroque architecture. It was paid for by the same Borda who made a fortune when he started the second silver boom in Taxco. It is next to Plaza Borda (the Zocalo) and one minute away from the Casa Borda as well. All are right in the middle of the city that owes Borda much. The entire city is built on a hillside but the central area and all the Borda names are on a small area that is relatively flat which adds to the appeal of this part of town.

4994390.name: Beautiful !
4994390.author: a TripAdvisor user
4994390.reviewBody: We took a "tour" out of Acapulco, well actually a van ride with 3 other couples, that led us to Taxco and Cuernavaca.  It was quite a drive but well worth it.  The silver shops were great, and the Santa Prisca Church was amazing.  It is truly an incredible surprise.  The paintings inside rival anything you\'ll see in Europe.  There are some very surprising and amazing  illusions that the architects came up with.  It\'s worth the scenic drive.\n

349169732.name: An outstanding place to learn Spanish
349169732.author: a TripAdvisor user
349169732.reviewBody: I studied Spanish here, in 2007.  I visit them every year, walk around the beautiful property and relax.  It\'s a fascinating site - all the way back to Cort\u00e9s.  It\'s full of history and remarkable architecture.  The school is very professional, friendly and helpful.  Martha, the secretary, is delightful.  Sof\u00eda, Alicia and Jorge are outstanding Spanish teachers.  Kyle is an excellent English teacher.  I got full credit, and transferred it back to Ohio State, as the school gives college credit through UNAM (la Universidad Nacional Aut\u00f3noma de M\u00e9xico.  It\'s at the top of a hill, so you have to be ready to walk/hike a bit - good exercise!

338574812.name: Old Family home in Mexico
338574812.author: a TripAdvisor user
338574812.reviewBody: This Hacienda was my wife\'s home when she grow up in Mexico as a child. Her Father Andres Sullivan also grew up in Taxco and his father "Sully" brought out the magic of this wonderful Hacienda as people from around the world would come to stay here and enjoy the beautiful town of Taxco.  The Sullivan family sold the Hacienda to the government and has since come back to the U.S. They still travel to Taxco on occasion as they have a family member forever on the Hacienda del Chorrillo site. Sometimes, on a quite moonlit night her spirit can be seen walking the grounds she loved so dearly.

306773200.name: Good place to study Spanish
306773200.author: a TripAdvisor user
306773200.reviewBody: The public university of Mexico has a school for foreigners to learn Spanish there so we went to explore the possibility of studying there.  The staff were very receptive, kind, and encouraging.  The grounds are a little in disrepair, but in a charming sort of way.  The pool is kept clean.

463297548.name: Ezequiel Tapia - an exquisite silver sculptor
463297548.author: a TripAdvisor user
463297548.reviewBody:
Like everyone else, we were wondering the streets of Taxco looking for interesting silver jewelry. By chance, we entered this gallery, called Exeltapia. We were amazed with the exquisite work and started talking to the lady, who invited us to arrive the next day to meet the master - Ezequiel. 
The guy is 82 years of age, and has incredible talent. We ended up looking at his sculptures and admiring his 63 years of work. Such a humble person with loads of talent.
This place stands up as not just a jewelry shop but a manifestation of the amount of artistic talent in the city.
Recommended!

569589149.name: Tris is an amazing town
569589149.author: a TripAdvisor user
569589149.reviewBody: And this chuch is one of the reasons, enjoy this area and you can take many pictures fron diferent angles

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

462585895.name: Interesting exhibits
462585895.author: a TripAdvisor user
462585895.reviewBody:
Somehow I missed this place on my first visit to Taxco, so what a surprise to find an absolutely lovely cultural centre.  I believe the exhibits will rotate, but we saw an amazing one about a well known local clothing designer and her history over the decades.  

Also a wonderful poster exhibit and works of silver art.  

Don't miss it as I did!  Right on the central plaza.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

380022749.name: A building full of History
380022749.author: a TripAdvisor user
380022749.reviewBody: We had a local guide who told us wonderful stories about William Spratling and the beggining and consolidation of the silvercrafts in Taxco. He spent about 45 minutes telling us charming and interesting stories, it was worthwhile even if 50% was true!

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

368617452.name: very nice, relaxing...
368617452.author: a TripAdvisor user
368617452.reviewBody: very nice, relaxing,  place, the building looks beautiful, the architecture is great, really we liked.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

350202501.name: Stop-over in Taxco
350202501.author: a TripAdvisor user
350202501.reviewBody:
During my travel from Mexico city toward Acapulco I paused at Taxco for about four and half hours.

I decided to make a trip up to a view spot in the town. The temperature was warm and I provided myself with mineral water.

I turned my face up a little every minute and I was quite exhausted when I reached the target. The view up there was fantastic and I fell asleep very well that night.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

328192376.name: Wow how impresive
328192376.author: a TripAdvisor user
328192376.reviewBody: Kept the local trades busy knocking up this building and still looks great centuries latter the surrounding silver shops are a nice distraction.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

322996219.name: Taxco, the Mexican place to be
322996219.author: a TripAdvisor user
322996219.reviewBody: I loved this place and this is how I imagined Mexico. This old silver city with its spectacular church deeply impressed me. It is an 4 hour drive from Mexico City, but really worth it.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

278543898.name: Taxco Town of Silver
278543898.author: a TripAdvisor user
278543898.reviewBody: After taking a very winding mountain road you will arrive at the quaint little town of Taxco, know for it\'s silver.  This is a fairly long day trip from Mexico City (about 2.5 hour drive)  The town itself is small with narrow cobbled streets and many silver jewelry shops. There is a beautiful Catholic Church on the square.  Lots of restaurants.  It\'s a long drive for a short visit.  The quality of the silver here is superb.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

266890500.name: Attractive outside, but little else
266890500.author: a TripAdvisor user
266890500.reviewBody: Free to enter, with nothing of note to see. Most of the rooms were locked on all three floors and the staff on show weren\'t interested at all.  Nothing in the walls explaining anything, poor showing.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

197185904.name: Just on the main sqaure in Taxco and free to visit
197185904.author: a TripAdvisor user
197185904.reviewBody: They had a beautiful display of silver pieces that were part and parcel of an annual Silver artifact design completion in Taxco.  There is so much art, design and silver to admire in this exhibit that you finally recognize the quality of workmanship and creativity of the Mexican silversmiths. \n \nThe Casa de Cultura also offers free movies, conferences and displays through the year. There are also courses in Spanish and Art for long-stay visitors at no cost or at very reasonable fees.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

135028880.name: poor service
135028880.author: a TripAdvisor user
135028880.reviewBody: they have good food its just that the waiters dont serve you right they take for ever and they seem upset.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

131621069.name: Nice view, thats all
131621069.author: a TripAdvisor user
131621069.reviewBody: Same company as hotel victoria, the ruin aka Bates Motel

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

116236987.name: Attractive Silver/Platinum jewerly & designs for cheap!
116236987.author: a TripAdvisor user
116236987.reviewBody: It\'s a little town specialized in Silver/Platinum designs. The prices vary you can find things from expensive to decent/cheap prices it\'s all about the detail pinto a particular item among other things. Everything is hand made and from there it\'s imported to a lot of other places in Mexico as well as around the world.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

115858767.name: Traveling and visiting Taxco
115858767.author: a TripAdvisor user
115858767.reviewBody:
Taxco is a wonderful colonial town. It is just a 2 and half hours south of Mexico City or just a short distance from Cuernavaca. It is small but unusually populated town nestled in the mountains. The buildings are all white with red tile roofs giving it an amazing view against the mountains.
I have found that there are several things you can do there. The obvious is shop for silver and visit the Sta Prisca church but there are also two small museums and some outdoor eco tours in the National Park Huizteco. 

If you are going to buy silver I would recommend not listening to your tour guide or any guide for that matter as they recieve a 20 to 30% comission. I found a wonderful store just below the town plaza and many other dealers in a jewelry mall in front of this store. They offered very fair prices and no commission. 

Try the pozole as well. It is a typical dish served every thursday in the state of Guerrero. It is very delicious and goes well with a shot of tequila :D

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)

22556125.name: Taxco\'s cultural center
22556125.author: a TripAdvisor user
22556125.reviewBody: This Casa is the city\'s cultural center. The building goes back to Borda himself who revived Taxco when he discovered silver in the 18th century and started a second silver boom. Today art, music, and other cultural events all are centered in this building. Walk through it and you will find some classrooms, hear piano music, and discover some art exhibits. Take a look through the front windows and there is the Zocalo or town square. If there is anything going on in Taxco you can find out about it here. Plus the building is interesting enough just to walk through and see what\'s all there. Nothing fanastic but a nice old piece of architecture in the middle of town.

itemReviewed.name: Casa de la Cultura de Taxco (Casa Borda)
